On the contrary, Com Chien Bo Nuong was a bit simplish and the bbk beef seemed gummy. For dessert, the limoncello cake was surprisingly good, not overtly rich (I usually don't eat desserts). Service was attentive and professional. Plates were reasonably priced and perfect size for a lunch meal. We'll go back.

We were on our way for a late lunch at White Elephant Thai (see my review) when it struck me that they are not open in late afternoon. They re-open at five for dinner. Serendipitously that very morning a friend told me about a good French/Vietnamese restaurant in Willow Grove. With a little help from MapQuest we made our way to yet another one of those unassuming spots in a strip shopping area. The space is handsomely appointed and tables are set with cloth napkins in bishop’s miter, tall glasses and all necessary utensils including fine chop-sticks on a porcelain stand. The wait staff, a young man and young woman (curiously non-Asian) attended to is with all affability. As always, we ask them what they find the best dishes. From the appetizes we selected the rolls that are not fried (I never remember which are Spring and which Summer). From the entrées we chose the chicken in mango and from the bun B7. Bun Tom Nuong Cha-Gio Chay rice vermicelli with grilled marinated shrimp & crispy vegetable spring rolls. Each dish, beautifully presented, offered a very clean and tasteful experience. The only coming was the tiny bowl of rice that wouldn’t feed a lark.
When the bill came it turned out to be $40 including tax and 20% tip for four people. You couldn’t buy dinner at Wawa for that price.

Dined here on a saturday night, 4 people, 7:30 reservations- the place was packed to the brim. Its a small restaurant, so it was insanely loud- even the waitress was yelling the specials. Service was very good, the chef even came to the table to ask how we would like one of the pho options prepared. We all enjoyed our meals, and would possibly get take out, but it was way too loud that we wouldn't go back.

Tucked in a small strip shopping center, this French/Asian restaurant is excellent. Service is highly professional and the food is excellent. The appetizers, like the shrimp bags, are outstanding, and the main courses are uniformly memorable.

We found Imperial Quy-Bau by looking for high rated restaurants not too far from home. We had driven by this place for years and had never given it a second thought.
Inside, it is cozy, nicely decorated and although small, did not feel too cramped even when busy.
We had no idea what to order in this Thai French fusion menu, so we followed the suggestion of the waiter.
The food is delicious, obviously made from fresh ingredients and cooked to perfection. Although we usually do not order much fried food, we tried the golden bags which are just ridiculously good. We followed with the po - also incredible, and the barbecued beef. Just perfectly flavored and cooked.
The dishes range from $9 to $30 per main dish although most fall in the $12 range which is amazing considering the quality of the food
The restaurant is a BYOB which makes the bill even better!
It gets busy pretty quickly so dinner reservations are a good idea.
Pleasant ambiance and good service but not sending post cards. Duck is heated in a deep fat fryer. The place is nicer than the strip center it's in

Tried 3 different dishes, Pho Thailand, Pad Thai with Cashew, Rice with Chicken. All were good. The chef came out to offer us a special house made spicy sauce and asked if everything was good and if anything was required. The waiter was pleasant, caring and accomodative. Much Appreciate. A super bowl pho was split for 3 with extra meat and each plate came out excellent. Enjoyed our thai experience in Philly, Will return when back in town

An exquisite menu of Viet-Namese/Asian/french influence. Varied menu..something for everyone. You can easily make a meal with a couple of their unusual appetizers...don't miss the "little bags" and the puff pastary escarot. And... skip dessert and order the MUST HAVE Viet Namese coffee.
I've been to this restaurant three times and have thoroughly enjoyed my meal each and every time! The service is good too. I highly recommend this restaurant!

Having enjoyed multiple meal at Colonial Quy Bau, I can say with certainty that the food is excellent. I prefer to go for lunch, as the restaurant is quiet, and many of the same menu items are available. I cannot resist the iced Vietnamese coffee. Enjoy!
Interesting menu but with mediocre results..waitstaff seemed to disappear.... My suggestion would be to hire extra waitstaff and in the kitchen!

From the wonderful roasted pepper salad and escargot in a tasty puff pastry, to the practically fillerless crab cake and tender duck this Asian fusion restaurant in a strip mall is superb. The service was wonderful. The only thing that prevents me from giving it five stars is the noise level. 93 db peak which limits conversation, especially for the hearing challenged.

This place is AMAZING!! Literally anything on the menu is phenomenal. The owner is the chef who prepares all dishes meticulously,. The menu consists of Thai, Vietnamese and Asian fusion dishes and are all extremely delicious. This restaurant is one of our favorites in the area and is highly recommended. BTW, the wait staff is very good too. Overall a great experience throughout!!!

This was our first visit, after a friend recommended the restaurant. We were not disappointed! Soup, calamari, seafood special and soft shell crab entree with green curry sauce - it all delivered! Service was very good, very conscientious. We will be back!

You could easily miss the neighborhood gem which has a wonderful array of Asian and Asian Fusion foods. Anything on the menu is interesting, tasty, delicious and plentiful and the desserts are to die for. Wait staff is quite knowledgeable and will help you. I highly recommend the Thai coffee for desert...a real taste treat sensation
Super well prepared interesting Asian fusion food. Fresh well prepared and good value. Knowledgeable wait staff.

Had an early dinner here on a Sunday night. By 7 o'clock the place was pretty full. appetizers soup and main dishes were fantastic, beautifully presented, and well served.

Eugene, our server, knew the menu very well and was able to provide lots of detail as well as additions which we followed. Will dibe here again.

This was our first time at this highly recommended French Asian restaurant. At 8:00 pm the place was packed and we waited 20 min for a table, no big deal as it was a Sat night and we were waiting for our friends to join us.
My husband, who checked out the online menu prior to arrival, was looking forward to the puff pastry escargot, but they ran out of that. Our waiter recommended an app called Golden Bags instead- a mixture of shrimp & crab in a pastry bag tied with a scallion and quick fried with a sweet and spicy chile sauce which was excellent and enough to pass around and share. The waiter brought out 2 orders and placed them in front of the guys and after about 30 seconds, quickly came back and removed them, stating that a mistake has been made, those were for the next table! Lucky for them nobody sneezed on them or touched them!! We just laughed it off, but felt the waiter was a bit off his game.
About 5 minutes later, all of our apps were delivered and what we had was excellent! I tried the Thai chicken coconut soup with mushrooms and my friend had the grilled octopus salad. We enjoyed both. We all agreed to share a Bun bowl with BBQ pork, shrimp and rice noodles, served with a crisp spring roll, just to try a genuine Vietnamese offering. The meat was tasty but we felt it needed a sauce on the side since rice vermicelli was bland.
My Shrimp Pad Thai was truly the best I have had anywhere. My husband's Crispy Half Duck in blueberry chambord glaze was perfectly prepared. Our friends both had the Seafood Medley which is a little spicy for myself but they both loved it.
After reading about the lemoncelo marscapone cheese cake on these reviews, I was looking forward to trying it for dessert, but, alas, they ran out. Next time, I will order it first, since it is their most popular dessert - suggested by the staff. Our creme brûlée was just perfect and coffee had a hint of cinnamon which I loved! Again though, another waiter foible, he took dish away without asking if we were finished...which I was not, there was half left! Felt as if he was rushing us to leave as it was after 10 pm, although there were still other diners there.
Although it is quite loud in there with a full crowd, I would highly recommend this restaurant to friends based on the food alone. I am more than happy to come back and give this another go. Next time we will come earlier to assure we get to try the dishes we want before they run out.

Three of us dined here for the first time this week. It was a rainy midweek dinner but the restaurant was busy. We were seated right away in a booth and the weather outside and the location in a shopping center were immediately forgotten. It is a very clean and attractive restaurant and the servers were excellent. They had many specials and I appreciated that the price was given as each one was recited. We enjoyed every dish and I especially enjoyed the beef potstickers. There were many things on the menu that I look forward to trying on our next visit.

Nice ambience, very friendly and accommodating staff, and the owner is wonderful! He made special vegetarian Pho for us....no meat, chicken, fish broth! He even made a special starter platter for us, which was delicious! We sat at the restaurant for about 2+ hrs and they were not in a rush for us to leave. We even had one of the best desserts....limoncello mascarpone cheese cake! Yummy!
Consistently good. The specials are always different and delicious. Nice décor. A little noisy, but only because it is always so busy.

We read the reviews here for this wonderful Asian "Fusion" restaurant and we have to say... BRAVO to the chefs, owner, wait staff. Just the right amount of spice, just enough variety without being over or underwhelming. The food is cooked with fresh ingredients (you can tell) and is deeelish! And, being a BYOB, it's even more affordable! Our waiter was wonderfully attentive and this establishment is strives to make the experience relaxing and top-notch. Without going on and on.... we have to say - don't let the location sway you... it IS worth trying.... again and again.

lovely décor, wonderful jazz, pristine surroundings, superb service with beautifully prepared Asian fusion cuisine
what a treat and the fact that it is a byo did not hurt in the least
hubby and I dined at lunch time and loved every morsel
very affordable
This restaurant provides all you need for an enjoyable evening or lunch. Food is outstanding, service is professional, atmosphere is good. All you need is BYOB and enjoy the greatness.

This was probably our fifth or sixth time at Colonial. The food continues to be fabulous, but the food service has declined. The place was full but that still does not justify a 45 min to an hour wait for appetizers. Other tables were experiencing the same delays. Note that this did not seem to be the fault of the servers, but rather a kitchen bottleneck.

This is one of those hidden gems that you pass in the nondescript strip mall every day until you stop in and realize -- wow, these folks know what they're doing. (So what are they doing HERE? Never mind, please don't go!) Everything we had was excellent, tasty and creative. Service was fine even though the place was crammed on a Saturday night. I recommend the green curry chicken, and the lemon marscapone cake is to die for.

This is my third time at the Colonial Quy-Bau and it is still absolutely fine. The service is very friendly and helpful. Food is excellent and well prepared . Always tastes fresh!
Great for a couple or for a small group. However, on the weekends it can be noisy. I would absolutely return.

This BYOB has been on the top of my restaurant list for years. Best dinner within 5 miles...and very very dependable. Rarely have I gone to eat here and not come away feeling deliciously full and feeling great about the food! It is great for a crowd, many different choices on the menu...and all excellent. Usually have a table free that you don't have to wait too long, but they do take reservations! Worth the money!

HEAVEN at an amazing food place...didn't even expect the service, based on location - just in the strip mall near me...TOTALLY blown away...each course is simple beautiful to look at, as it is presented, not just served...served just doesn't do justice to each dish...it is GIFTED to you...and delicious!~

I had the Duck Fried Rice and Escargot en Crute at this lovely BYOB. The Chef Corey and manager/owner trained at Susanna Foo and Corey also cooked at one of George Perrier's Bistro. Great price and quality, will do menu planning for Wine Dinners. I will be back.

Went to Colonial with my wife,13 yo son and a high school friend and his wife. Everything we all tried was fantastic. The fish was fresh with a great sauce, the pad tai was the best we ever had and the duck was delicious. We were surprised when the chocolate and lemoncello cakes were also good. BYOB helps with the reasonable cost of the meal. All and all a great meal.
This is the second time that I have dined here. The food is very good, and the prices are very reasonable. The Thai Spring Rolls are excellent! BYOB

The food was great, limited on the main menu but there were 3 specific menus I wasn't familiar with so I stuck to the main one.
The shrimp/ dumpling soup was just perfect.
The Golden Bags (wonton filled shrimp/crab) with tasty and flavorful, just enough sauce to make these terrific.
The crabcakes sandwich was amazing. My friend raved about her lunch as well.
Atmosphere, fabulous and chic.
Service, top notch for such a small place.
Decor - beautiful.
Parking - adequate considering it is a small strip mall.
Even the bathroom was gorgeous, lol!

Delicious! My wife said not to write the review, because then everyone would come here and they should. We had the Seafood sampler and the Portabello crabmeat special appetizers. Both were great. Chicken Pad Thai was awesome, as was the Duck with Pinapple Chutney. We don't usually get dessert, but it was going so well, we said "what the heck", and splurged on the Almond cream cake (sorta like Tiramisu). Service was excellent. This restaurant is in a little strip mall, but don't let that sway you. Inside is decorated very nicely and atmosphere was terrific.

Having eaten here many times with both family and friends,I have never had a bad meal.The place is lovely, and the service is very attentive. I have always eatten off the French side of the menu. I especially love the pineapple duck. They get very crowded on Saturdays, and the service is aliitle slower, I'm happier going during week,as I don't like crowds!!

I was in town for a convention with the president and his family of the company. My guest was hungry after a exhausting day. I looked up on yelp and trip advisor and was looking for a nice place to eat. I found a couple of places that was rated 4 to 5 stars.I didn't want to be embarrassed !!! My guest was in the mood for something unique. So i chose this place. Colonial Quy Bau. When we enter the restaurant. I and my guest was Amazed. First thing we noticed that it was well maintained. We was greet by a very pretty host. She sat us at the upper window level. As we were getting comfortable a server approached us immediately. He explained to us the different types of menu ( French Asian and The Vietnamese Menu ) and the specials of the evening. He was very knowledgeable and kind and recommended us with a couple of different samplers. I was blown away !!!! As the nite progressed each course was fresh and delicious. From the time we enter to the time we left it was the best dining experience. My boss and family was very happy. I would no doubt recommend this restaurant to anyone and not be embarrassed.

My wife and I continuously search for the next best Pho place, we stumbled upon this quaint place while getting lost out in Willow Grove. My wife being Vegetarian struggles to find places to eat Pho, while I am always on the lookout for a place with good beefball pho. Well...we found it. This is our new #1 choice, albeit, about a 35 minute drive for us, both times we have gone we have been extremely happy. The service is great, ambiance is quiet yet hip, prices are great (only been for lunch so far), overall excellent. You may think, ahhh well you haven't had every pho how can you judge? Yes, Pho taste is subjective, but this is the real deal. I have been all over NY, and Philadelphia, and this is by far the tastiest broth I have found.

We called around 4;30 for a 6:30 reservation for my wife and I and our 2 kids (12&15). Online menu looked great and food did not disappoint! We were seated upon arrival at 6:25. Only complaint is that waitress suggested a side of fried rice. Plate cost $9 and we barely touched it because the entries all came with rice, vegetables or noodles. Creme Brulee dessert was excellent. Trying to get out of the restaurant was a nightmare as a huge crowd was waiting to be seated and there is very little room for people to wait. I'm sure it was because it was New year's Eve and not an everyday occurrence. Which also meant it was probably unusually loud as well.
This BYOB never fails. The servers are knowledgeable and the food is fresh and very tasty. The luncheon menu needs to be tried next.
My family love going here not only do the have Pho but they also have great other selection of fusion french. BYOB is also a plus!

Food was delicious, but we all felt that the waiter was somewhat abrupt. Plus, we ordered 5 appetizers and only got 4. In fact, my wife specifically said, "that makes 5 appetizers" when we ordered. Anyone can have a bad day, so I'd go back.

The Asian fusion menu is diverse, with something for everyone. If you like seafood, meats, light, fried, Pho, vegetarian, gluten free...whatever, you'll find something to love. Our friend (who has eaten Pho around the world) said the homemade broth Pho was the best she'd ever had. Portions are generous and beautiful. The staff is well-trained and overseen by a professional manager who trained with the best. Corey, the owner and chef makes his rounds during the evening and will stop to talk without being intrusive. He will share his experiences cooking in some of the top Philadelphia restaurants. You can tell this is his passion. The atmosphere is relaxed but attractive. BYOB. If there is a weak spot it would be desserts, which do not rise to the standard of the rest of the menu. We will be back again and again.
Service was very good. I had the pastry escargot appetizer and seafood meledy.Both were very good. It us a BYOB so consider that in your planning.

Great gem right off of Rt 611 in a small strip shopping center. Wait staff was super attentive.
Sean our waiter was very informative on the specials and provided super service, we went with his recommendations and were very pleased with a calamari mango salad which we shared, fantastic soup, salmon and veal chop for our entrees. It is a BYOB. Fair prices. Comfortable, nice dining area. Very clean.This is now one of our favorite places. Good location off of Rt 611, Rt 63 and turnpike. Open about a 1.5 years. Not sure why we have not made it here before. We give out only an excellent rating if deserved.

Tried this surprisingly delicious restaurant based on the raves of another couple during a birthday dinner at Blue Sage. What a pleasant find! The food options vary between French and Thai or Vietnamese. The waitstaff is efficient, extremely polite and attentive. That alone is worth the trip back, but the food was the star at this BYOB in Willow Grove, just a stone's throw from the mall or the Abington hospital.

The duck entree was excellent and the soft shelled crabs with green curry equally yummy. Even the fried rice (an a la carte) extra was worth ordering. The fish special (salmon with crab, a delicate potato side) was demolished by its recipient. Portions are generous and tastes are rich. No one in our table of 5 diners was disappointed.

We'll be back. As this spot is popular, would suggest reservations are it is a small spot in an in an unassuming strip mall.

My wonderful son took leave from the Air Force and flew cross country to take me to dinner for my birthday. I had heard wonderful things about this restaurant so I was delighted when he suggested it. The menu was extensive and varied. The "specials" were also very interesting and could be done with your choice of fish (Salmon, Mahi mahi, Tuna or Tilapia) The quality of food was impressive. The only downside? was we did not know it was a BYOB so we had no wine with dinner. I am taking a dear friend there tonight to celebrate her birthday and will not forget the wine. The desserts were awesome and my Chocolate Mousse arrived on a dish that was decorated with a handwritten "Happy Birthday" in a delightful Raspberry sauce.

Comfortable dining atmosphere with dim lighting and minimal decor. The professional wait staff offered so many specials to choose from. I went with a spicy shrimp entree which I liked very much. Plenty of vegetables on the plate along with large shrimp in a mildly spiced sauce. For dessert I ordered the Limoncello cake with mascapone. It was so light with a wonder lemon flavor I was scraping the fork against the plate to get all of it. The bill for two people came to $59.83. Next time I will not order the sparkling water for $6 a bottle however I will order the cake again and I will frequent this restaurant very often.

Apparently this restaurant has been open for about a year and a half, but I went there for the first time yesterday. Was seriously impressed with the quality of all the food we ordered (4 of us). Fried calamari appetizer and "purses" were great. Calamari was not greasy at all, and no tentacles in the portion. Seafood medley, drunken noodles with chicken and shrimp, and the fish special (tuna) were our entrees, and they were all generous portions and flavorful. Only complaint is I asked for 3 out of 4 spicy level on my entree and it was still totally bland (waiter did bring me chili paste to fix that). Lemon cake for dessert was light and flavorful. Prices were very reasonable given the high quality of food and portions size. Plenty of other items sounded wonderful, so we will definitely be going back. Noise level a bit much, but place was packed. Give it a try, if you have not been there.

We just stopped in for dinner and the food was good but the staff is disorganized. While we ordered correctly, the server even read it back, everything was wrong. They even came out at one point with the wrong food.
I had the crispy chicken and there was absolutely nothing crispy about it.

If you want to venture out to this place, really really make sure they know that you are ordering.

Face it. I am a picky, difficult-to-please traveller and restaurant-goer. Read my reviews. I'm reminded that in Anna Karenina, Tolstoy wrote: "If you look for perfection, you'll never be content." Still... I look. Colonial Quy Bau is close to it. I first went here months ago, thinking it was a classic (and standard Vietnamese fare restaurant). It wasn't... And because I went there expecting it to be so, I was disappointed. I went back tonight... after reading their menu and adjusting my expectations to French - Asian mix cuisine. Our meal was truly fantastic. Everything was fresh as fresh can be. Prepared to darn-near perfection. Staff was so helpful and friendly. The owner spoke with us repeatedly. The Manager too. Decor is comforting and warm-chic. Clean. Comfortable. I will become a regular... And that is the greatest compliment anyone can give a restaurant.

If you're out shopping in the area, this spot, located in a small strip center, is a great find!
We came one Friday evening and ended up having dinner. It was busy when we arrived around 8:30 pm or so.
By the way, it's a BYOB.
We ordered some appetizers and then dinner and everything we had was really great!
Parking is easy, right out front.
Good service, energetic noise level and good food.
We will come back to dine again and will bring friends!

This is my favorite restaurant in Willow Grove for dinner. The atmosphere is attractive and comfortable, the staff pleasant, the food amazing. The chef used to work at a 5 star restaurant in Philly. I've also heard his recipe for scalloped potatoes is a well-guarded secret, which i believe since i've never tasted better! Try the crispy duck. It's outstanding, (and with it comes the scalloped potatoes). My husband assures me that the other dishes are every bit as good as the crispy duck, but I can't try anything else because I ordered duck on our first visit, and have craved it ever since. I did have a special appetizer once, shu mai which was also out of this world. Tender, melt in your mouth, with a delicate shrimp flavor ...I could go on, but I won't.

The food is very reasonably priced for it's quality. The duck is about $21. It's BYOB

Also, the correct name of the restaurant is Colonial Quy Bau, not "Colonila"

I love this restaurant. The food is always cooked to perfection and the service is very good. Weekends are busy and reservations are highly recommended. There is take out service too. On the weekends the noise level is "energetic" The regular menu has lots of selections as well as specials your server will tell you about. I love the fact this is a BYOB.
The menu is Asian/French/Vietnamese.
We've been here a few times, the food is consistently good with an interesting twist. Good service. Byob
Been going here for ages, with family and friends. Even when ordering online the food tastes fantastic. I really love the bun cha and the bahn mi, both with chicken.

This place is a hidden gem in Leuven. It’s hidden behind several hip and trendy restaurants on the tiensestraat. It was recommended to me by a friend and I was positively surprised.

The dishes served here are very good and large. I ate here almost 10 times and never was dissatisfied with what I got. Everything is very reasonably priced especially for this part of Leuven. I am always surprised that people do not know of this place.

The staff is very polite as well.

I would definitely recommend this place to anyone studying or visiting Leuven and who is in for Vietnamese food.

There is no, or at least not much, space to sit down and eat it on the spot. So it is mainly take away.

We ordered on Sunday evening via takeaway.
The order was prepared and ready to take away upon arrival. The lady in the restaurant was super friendly.
Food was of excellent quality and take-away boxes are reusable.
We'll come back for more :-)
Nice small place in the center of Leven, you can find a very good Vietnamese food! The price is cheap and the athmosphere is relaxed. Only the cook is not kind to customers. Recommended.
One of those great places where the food is delicious, fast and fair prices. I come here often and the place is always full - they've got all the vietnamese goods. Great taste and helpful people.
Ah! Quy is my favourite lunch spot in Leuven. I absolutely love their noodle soup! Really kind people also, I will definitely come back really soon!
Friendly staff, great cheap food and also food for vegans and healthy food. I love this place, I totally recommend!

This is a typical Asian fast food restaurant that serves fried rice, noodles, salads, sandwiches en noodle soup. The food is cheap, but the quality is good and the owners are real Vietnamese. The pho noodle soup I ordered was very savory. The interior is rather Spartan, but I didn't mind. After all, you come here for a quick bite to eat, not for an extensive meal. It was a bit chilly though, so I had to keep on my jacket.

Ah! Quy is my favourite place to go for food!

Not only they serve excellent, freshly prepared and quality food, but also the owner is super friendly and always smiling :D

I am a vegetarian so cannot speak for the dishes that contain meat, but Quy (the owner's name) makes really good vegan alternatives of the meat dishes and I love each and every of these! My carnivore friends are also very satisfied with their portions, so I guess those are good too ;)

Quality-price-customer service ratio = superb! Very student friendly - Highly recommend!

Thanks Quy!

We went there with a group of 6 girls. We had a delicious dinner. The baked noodles, The traditional Vietnamese Pho soup and tje Vietnamese salad were all excellent! Thank you! We will come back for sure! :)
Deliciously authentic and cheap Vietnamese meals, with a side dish of friendliness and helpfulness. Don't let the fact that they have pictures scare you!
Love the food there. Still keep the traditional flavour of Asian / Vietnamese food. Will come back soon

I'm Vietnamese and I'm student of KU Leuven university. I miss Vietnamese food badly after 3 years of studying abroad. Honestly, it's quite difficult to find Vietnamese restaurant in Leuven. Fortunately, now I can try a lot Vietnamese food at Ah! Quy. Thanks again for the owner and staff. The foods are very nice, for instance, Vietnamese sandwich (Banh Mi) with different flavor like beef, pork and chicken. And the famous noodle soup called PHO (Beef noodle soup). That's so amazing !

Congratulations to Ah! Quy. Finally, someone had the guts to open a new asian restaurant that is not a sushi place. Leuven needed this badly. Thanks again to the owner and staff to make this happen.
Ah! Quy serves Vietnamese buns (Banh mi), soups (Pho), salads and the like. I had the Banh Mi with roasted pork and it was to die for.
Crispy sandwich, tender pork, cillantro, (pcikled?) radishes and cucumber and finally a delicious sauce to bind it all together. Recipe, please?
I will definitely be visiting this place more often: bye bye "smos kaas hesp" on Friday!

Voor het geld was het eten ok
Er stond een lange rij maar we hoefden niet lang te wachten. Je moet hier vooral geen luxe verwachten.

Het was de eerste keer dat ik hier kwam. Zeer eenvoudige goedkope inrichting. De soep was lekker, goede bouillon, noedels waren al gekookt en werden opgewarmd. Vriendelijke man die bediende. Zelfs in de namiddag genoeg studenten die honger hadden. Advies aan het personeel: Wil aub de tafels afkuisen als iemand klaar is met eten, ik vond maar 1 propere tafel. Wil aub uw toilet goed poetsen.

Sinds Ah! Quy in 2017 de deuren opende, kan men ook in Leuven terecht voor eenvoudige Vietnamese gerechten. De menukaart bestaat uit belegde broodjes, soepen, salades en diverse schotels met gebakken noedels of rijst. Voor de warme gerechten kan de klant kiezen uit kip, varken, rund of het vegetarische tofu. Verschillende groenten en een huisgemaakte dressing naar voorkeur maken het bord compleet. De gerechten smaken lekker af, maar zijn relatief klein van portie. De democratische prijzen vormen een bijkomende troef, want voor minder dan 10 euro kan men bij Ah! Quy een lekkere en gezonde maaltijd nuttigen. De bediening verloopt ten slotte hartelijk en vlot.

Ah! Quy is op weekdagen geopend van 12 tot 15 uur en van 17u30 tot 20 uur. Op zaterdag kan men hier terecht van 12 tot 16 uur. Deze zaak geniet een grote populariteit bij studenten, hetgeen het vinden van een vrije plaats soms bemoeilijkt. Bij mooi weer is het fijn tafelen op het ruime terras, dat staat uitgestald op het verkeersarme Alfons Smetsplein.

Ik heb hier al enkele keren gegeten en je krijgt hier waar voor je geld, Ah! Quy is bij de goedkopere restaurants op het Alfons Smetsplein, je merkt dat hun doelgroep vooral studenten zijn. Redelijk autenthiek Aziatische smaken. Zeker een aanrader en bij de beste van Leuven qua smaken vind ik persoonlijk!

Ze zijn wel degelijk open, in tegenstelling tot wat de website zegt.

We zijn hier take-away Pho-Bo & Noodle-salade gaan halen. Prijs-kwaliteit een echte topper. Wij moeste normaal tot Brussel rijden als we zin hadden in authentieke, Vietnamese smaken, maar tegenwoordig komen we in Leuven dus ook aan onze trekken.

Wij komen hier zeker nog eens terug! (waarschijnlijk wekelijks)

Tip: de porties zijn niet super groot. Wanneer je écht grote honger hebt, neem dan gewoon 2 porties en zet de rest in de frigo voor de dag erna.

Direkt neben dem pentahotel versteckt sich dieser Geheimtipp. Mit nur wenigen Tischen bieten das Ah! Quy eine kleine Karte mit einer Hand voll typisch vietnamesischen Strassengerichten wie Bun Cha, Pho oder Sommerrollen - das ganze zum kleinen Preis. Die probierten Speisen haben uns dabei geschmacklich sehr an unseren Vietnamurlaub erinnert und sind deswegen auf jeden Fall authentisch, wenn auch nicht ganz so scharf wie in Saigon oder Hanoi. Als Alternative zu den doch gehobenen Preisen in vielen Restaurants kann man hier sehr gut eine Zwischenmahlzeit zu sich nehmen.

Chúng tôi đã ở tại khách sạn Ludwigs và nhà hàng này nằm ngay gần góc từ Trung tâm thông tin du lịch. Nó thực sự không giống như nhiều ở bên ngoài nhưng menu được đăng bên ngoài trông rất thú vị. Tôi rất vui vì chúng tôi đã có cơ hội! Vịt chiên giòn của họ thật tuyệt vời và kích thước phần lớn đến nỗi nó có thể cho hai người ăn. Bạn tôi có một món tôm mà cô ấy rất thích nhưng cũng đủ lớn cho hai người. Đối với ít hơn 20 euro, chúng tôi đã có một bữa ăn ngon và đồ uống (rượu / bia). Chúng tôi tìm thấy các nhân viên để được vui vẻ và thân thiện, đôi khi bạn chỉ cần có để thực hiện các nỗ lực. Thật là một trải nghiệm thú vị khi chúng tôi trở lại vào một buổi tối khác nhưng vào tối hôm đó, theo lời đề nghị của người phục vụ, chúng tôi đã chia sẻ một bữa ăn. Chúng tôi thấy chuyến thăm tiếp theo này là một trải nghiệm dễ chịu. Xin giới thiệu nhà hàng Kim Quy!

Eight of us decided at short notice to book a meal and we couldn’t have been made more welcome. The landlord and landlady pulled out all the stops to give us a friendly welcome and a good meal. We haven’t laughed so much in a long time with all the friendly banter!

We had 2 evening meals in this pub, whilst staying at the nearby Quy Mill Hotel. It's quite small, on both evenings the bar area was quite lively, but we went in the lounge/restaurant area that was very quiet and had our meals in peace. We had fish and chips, scampi and chips one evening, sweet potato and satay curry, and hunter's chicken the next, all well cooked and presented, very tasty. Nice friendly service, the ale was Timothy Taylor's Landlord and one called Pegasus.

Called in for lunch after visiting the local National Trust property. This is a proper unspoilt pub with great food and a cosy atmosphere. The chips were the best we've had for a very long time and great value for money.

Lovely village pub with a great pint of Timothy Taylor.
We popped in on a January Sunday afternoon and it was packed full of locals.
We were made to feel very welcome!

Staying in the village for a long weekend ate here on a Friday evening and really enjoyed everything. Friendly service, good food at very reasonable prices and a lovely warm fire on a cold December evening. Couldn't ask for anymore.

Visiting family locally and so pleased to meet the new landlady Kate. The pub is set in a small village surrounded by beautiful countryside just outside Cambridge.
Really friendly, lovely inviting atmosphere and to top it delicious home cooked food at affordable prices.
Called in at lunch time on our way back from visiting friends. What a lovely find, very friendly atmosphere the staff were attentive and helpful. The beer was great and the food even better.

What is the point of having a sign on the main road which makes you you come off it to go for lunch I need to find the place closed... certainly not a vote for the New Year and shall not be returning...

We were visiting friends in Cambridge area and came across this small local pub.
Very friendly atmosphere. Great beers. Went back and second night and had wine (excellent red wine). The proprietor, Matt, was great.
This place is not fancy, but we enjoyed it a great deal.

I've driven past this place so many times and finally, today we popped in for a post walk drink. I am so pleased we did. The pub was lovely. A real old school feel, bit with a good up to date selection of drinks and tasty sounding menu. There are pub games that seem to have disappeared from most pubs and a friendly atmosphere in the main bar. It's the kind of place you would want in your own village. If you have driven past it and never stopped like me, then give it a go, especially if you like your German lager served on a Stein!

Whilst the Pub:Restaurant gets good reviews our lunchtime experience was poor. We needed just toasted Caprese sandwiches and spicy Quesedilas as we were eating out in the evening. Our simple food took twice as long to arrive as fish and chips took to arrive for later arrivals. They had a minuscule amount of filling and very little taste. The Quesedilas were spice but also largely empty. Thankfully we live far enough away to have no reason to return

A few years back I used to come here for Sunday lunch. Last night (Thursday) i came with some mates for a few beers on a nice sunny evening cycle ride out of the city centre (25 mins: easy ride).

The White Swan was a welcoming pub. Now it's under new ownership and it's even better. A really welcome surprise. Beer (local breweries) was on great form. Landlord is very welcoming.

All in all a proper pub. Not a gastropub, not a restaurant with beer. A real pub with decent beer (and I think there's still food). Highly recommended and will definitely come back here soon!

We'd been for a visit to Anglesey Abbey and the cafe there was heaving, so we thought we'd try a local pub instead. This one was nearby so we we gave it a try.

On first turning up we thought it was closed and were a bit unsure about the parking situation. We went in the side door and initial impressions were "a local pub for local people!", so were a bit unsure. However we were quickly greeted by a friendly barmaid and shown the menu, though she told us it was only small and they'd run out of a couple of things.

We were hungry so thought we'd give it a go, and are so glad we did. We ordered the ciabatta pizzas which were absolutely delicious and presented really nicely. Took a little while to come out but you could see it was because they were freshly made, and we were happy having a drink anyway.

The drinks selection is great, lots of good ales and a large array of gins.

We could have quite easily just relaxed in the pub for the rest of the day. It has a very traditional feel which is lacking in so many pubs now, and I'd definitely return if I'm in the area again.

As their website says, it's probably "not for everyone", and if you prefer a chain pub and are a large group then it's maybe not for you. I was there with my wife and parents and it was spot on for us.

Popped in here before Anglesey abbey and would thoroughly recommend. We had to wait a little while for the food due to staffing issues. But it was definitely worth the wait. I had the fish and chips and this was huge and the chips were delicious. My girlfriend has the pizza and thoroughly enjoyed this. Very reasonable as meal and drinks came to £19.

We love this pub. We don't have the fortune of living in the village but we regularly drive out to it for a walk and visit to the Swan. It's friendly, relaxed and drinks are reasonably priced. We haven't eaten there yet but sure it's only a matter of time!

It is a local village pub it is fullof village hub welcomes passer s by afraid it no longers does food but still a nice pub we usually have to unscrew the landlords coffin just before dark but hey everyone has there faults lol

I am surprised by the positive reviews of this pub. We visited with our walking group of 24 people. We order at 9.30, go for our walk and return for lunch. We arrived back in good time at 12.15. We don't expect really speedy service being a large group, but this was awful. The serving of drinks was very much slower than we have experienced in most pubs. We then sat down for our food. This was the first problem. There were not enough seats in the bar area and we had to squash up together on the benches. It was most uncomfortable. There was another bigger room but it was in darkness and clearly not in use. There was a computer and papers on one of the tables in the bar area which put it out of use and looked messy. There was no cutlery or napkins on the tables so we got our own by searching in the other room. The whole place looked shabby and untidy and the cutlery was very old. The bar area was untidy with unwashed glasses.

The fried fish was unavailable as the order had not arrived (not their fault)but they only told our group this when individuals got drinks and paid before their meal rather than announce it to the group to allow for re ordering. My husband who was near the back of the queue, chose a burger because he was told it would be quick.

The food came out slowly, one bowl of soup at a time. After about 40 minutes my husband and I still hadn't been served and when we asked we were given a very curt "it's coming!" I eventually got my fish pie after about 45 minutes waiting and most of the group were nearly finished. It wasn't worth the wait. It was quite tasty but there was almost no fish in it, just a few tiny pieces. My husband was still waiting. Still no apology or information. When it finally came my husband complained about how long he had waited (an hour) for a burger. He got a very rude response saying 'This is not Macdonald's you know.' According to my husband the burger was average at best. Our group had all left by now. The cook did come back and give a grudging apology. "I was only given the order 15 minutes ago" he moaned. And yet there were only two staff -they clearly didn't communicate at all! Those who had soup said it was nice but not very warm. Others ordered ciabatta with caprese salad but it came with no ciabatta. They thought it wasn't worth complaining.

Clearly they didn't have the staff or the ability to deal with a large group. But we didn't surprise them, it had been booked some time ago. Their clear lack of interest in the pub or its customers was very disappointing.

I won't go back. I give it one star because apparently the chips were good!

This place is definitely worth a try
Friendly atmosphere and the staff are very pleasant. Meal in the bar was very good and the service was excellent
Would recommend to anyone

Nice pub obviously a well like local, we had sunday roast which was lovely and a good dish of vegetables. Dessert was apple and blackberry crumble with custard, very tasty. Good price for good food. Staff were friendly.

Went for lunch on a Friday lunchtime.
First impressions were disappointing after the reviews we had read on TA. The car park and rear entrance areas were untidy and scruffy. We went into the dining room and had to ask the waitress to remove 2 cardboard boxes from the table we were hoping to sit at. The bar area in the restaurant was also cluttered up with rubbish.
We ordered drinks and food which we found a bit pricey for just a basic pub and choice was a bit disappointing as well. Me and my father in law had the fish and chinos as nothing else appealed. The ladies had mushrooms and haloumi cheese which actually looked great.Fish was nice and tasted good although chips tasteless and only choice with it was ordinary peas (no mushy available as an option.).
Service was good but our main reason for the visit was to check the place out for a possible Sunday dinner booking but the untidiness made us change our mind and we went elsewhere instead.

Booked in for lunch after visiting the National Stud. Very welcoming and unhurried. Beef was pink in the middle (just as I like it). Sausage & mash went down well with the younger member of the group. Adnams Ghost Ship on draught served just right. Will return when next in the area.
Interesting food, large portions well cooked and not too expensive. Relaxed atmosphere with great service would be happy to return.

We popped in as we were passing lunchtime on a thursday. It was not very busy in the bar area. We ordered Liver and bacon on mash dish and a fish pie dish. Although the wait was 40 minutes the food was excellent, tasty, hot and enough so that we could not fit in a dessert. The bar staff were very pleasant and welcoming. Only downside was children in the bar but then that's us being past that stage :-) .

we booked a meal on a Sat night,quite busy but no issues.My wife had the old haloumi salad typical for vegys and i had a starter mushrooms on toast in sauce.this was gorgeous,followed by a big gammon and all trimmings,lovely.To end we shared sticky toffee pudding.Complete meal was lovely and well the prices we paid.We sat in restaurant side ,a little better than bar side but both sides typical country pub.Staff were very friendly,would recommend if near by.

Wanting to have an evening outside the hotel we were staying at this was an excellent find and the food was delightful. Bar staff were very helpful and, although not busy, did not feel that we were being pushed out whilst finishing off our drinks

Visited for lunch having been to nearby Anglesey Abbey. The menu is not huge but should have something to please anyone, with a mixture of pub classics and more unusual meals. My husband had fish and chips and I had the halloumi salad. Both were absolutely delicious. The chef was kind enough to make a plate of sausage and vegetables for our picky toddler even though this is not really on the menu. Service was friendly and helpful although not fast when it started to get busy. Would highly recommend!

Four of us booked a table for dinner after being recommended by a friend. Matt the landlord is a relaxed but very welcoming host. The range of beers was excellent and Matt knowledge and recommendations were first class. Two of our party had chicken and mushroom in a cream sauce and really enjoyed it. One had forest mushrooms on toast and asked for it without cream, the chef duly obliged and my friend really enjoyed the flavours and variety of mushrooms served. I had a seasonal dish off the menu which was a lamb burger with a hint of chilli and mint sauce. Everything was so fresh and tasty and the pub really relaxed and friendly. I would really recommend taking time to find this lovely pub.

Looking for a quick lunch meal after a nice walk and before an afternoon event. Saw the signs and pulled in. At first look we were a bit unsure as externally it looks like a small local, geared towards local trade. But, we needn't have worried. The greeting was warm and the restaurant area, whilst plain, was clean. The drinks took a wee while but that was a minor point, only one staff on. The menu was varied, but we not wanted a light lunch so went for hot sandwiches. They were swift in arrival and delicious, both bacon & brie and sausage and onion were served in soft toasted ciabatta and the chips were well cooked. A nice greeting, and overall a hidden gem.

My husband and I had a fantastic meal at the White Swan last Sunday evening. He had the fillet steak and I had fish and both were delicious - as were our chosen desserts of chocolate terrine and crumble. We would definitely recommend the White Swan for their food.

So why not give a score of five stars? It was because our first impressions were disappointing as it felt like we were sitting in the bar rather than a restaurant. I had expected a properly laid table (not just a cheap paper napkin with a knife and fork placed on top of it) a wine list (even if it isn't finalised) and smartly presented staff (not wearing T-shirt, jeans, leggings and casual jumper).

Would we return? Yes! The food was delicious, the staff were friendly, the prices were reasonable so don't be put off by first impressions!

What lovely, quality food! The best burger I have eaten in decades! I would go back anyday! The rest of the crowd ate fish and chips and it was great quality too!
Friendly staff. Not a luxurious ambience but so calm and friendly- you feel very comfortable!

I would highly recommend it for people who like to eat out and leave with full gratification!

We dined in this pub/restaurant one evening in April. The restaurant was deathly quiet so we opted to eat in the nice-looking bar of the pub. The food was average as was the service. Very strangely, there was no wine list!

Four of us booked a table for Sunday lunch. I must say the food was excellent. Two of us had lamb, one had beef and the other was pork. By the time I had finished I never had any room for a sweet. Two of our party had the sticky toffee pudding to share. I wish I had saved enough room for one because it was delicious.
Will definitely go back and it is very advisable to book.

Just called in to the White Swan for lunch and what a treat, excellent food and a good selection of beers and wines (as you would expect from a pub). If there is a down side to this pub it is that the interior could do with up dating. By far their biggest asset though is the wonderful staff.

We were staying in The Quy Mill hotel and wanted a bit of "pub grub"
Managed to get the last table so we knew it would be a bit busy.
Food was lovely, I had the pork and cider pie and my wife had the gammon, both were great. The panna cotta for desert was to die for, I ordered a portion only for myself as my wife was too full from the main course, however she got a second spoon and helped me finish it!!! Food was worth every penny but the service was a little slow. One of the 2 female bar/service staff didn't seem to do much leaving the other to run around servicing everyone so things did drag a bit. We would go back but probably on a quieter night
Really nice food, good service for 15 of us well looked after by staff, great selection of food, recommend to friends . Will visit again!!
Good well cooked food. Service good very friendly staff. Lunch menu not as interesting as a few months ago

I brought my parents here for lunch; we had a lovely meal, but I'm glad we weren't in a hurry! Our table was reserved for 12:30 and we didn't order starters; our main courses didn't arrive until gone 13:20. I think they were unexpectedly busy, but still.

That said, the food was really good - my steak was done just as I like it, and the mushroom sauce with it was really tasty. My Mum really enjoyed the duck leg, and Dad really enjoyed his gnocchi. They had 4 different real ales on (and the one I had was well kept). Food was very reasonably priced, too, especially given the quality which was really good.

Everyone agreed it'd been a really nice meal, we'd just liked to have not waited quite so much!

Visited today with my sister and nephew on way back from Anglesey Abbey, we went in not expecting to get a table, but thought we would just have a drink.
The pub and restaurant was busy, but we were acknowledged on arrival by a friendly smile from the landlord. He asked if we had a table reservation and when I said we didn't, he said that hopefully in 20 mins he might be able to help.
When I saw the fine selection of real ales I was very pleased to wait.
The meal was simply just as good a Sunday Roast as you could possibly wish for.
Excellently portion size, the lamb was generous and cooked to perfection.
We all enjoyed ourselves very much and will definitely return.
I understand the inn is under new management since November 2015, I wish them every success.

Thoroughly enjoyed our visit here in January. The place was cosy, friendly and well run. We had a lovely meal that was made with really fresh ingredients, it was well cooked and nicely presented.
The bar was stocked with interesting things from craft ales to aged single malt whiskeys. I would really recommend this place to anyone looking for a cosy, relaxed and welcoming establishment.

Lunch here with our walking group. Cosy retreat from the cold January wind of the Fens. Warm welcome in charming surroundings. Service helpful, cheery, informal, even a bit funky. Light lunches round the table: thrice cooked chips; leek and potato soup; jacket potatoes with toppings; various combinations of tasty things in ciabatta, e.g. sausage, goat’s cheese & roasted vegetables. All voted very good. Selection of interesting ales. Definitely one to go back to and try the dinner menu.

Note: very handy for visitors to excellent nearby Anglesey Abbey; and good out of town option if you are visiting Cambridge and want to escape clone food.

PS Don’t miss the extraordinary sign outside – look hard and the swan will reveal itself.

We ventured to Anglesey Abbey and unfortunately could not get into the grounds as we had our dogs with us; so settled for a nice walk along the river to the nearby village and found the White Swan. We asked about the dogs coming in - not a problem!
We settled with our two children (7&10) in the bar area, which is a proper pub. The restaurant side is lovely too but for us today as we were kitted up for walking.

I do like to be able to sit in a pub without the expectation that you are going to eat.

Well, we chose to eat, and the menu was lovely. My wife had the Nut Roast and I and the children opted for Sausage & Mash. Roasts & Fish options we're available, and is was also nice to see that smaller portions were available throughout.
Everything was great - Food, Quantity, Service, Beer, Atmosphere and Price.

We will return without the dogs to the Abbey and book ahead for another visit this pub 10/10

We were just passing through from a visit to Anglesey Abbey and fancied a Sunday lunch before travelling home. To be fair it didn't look much on the inside but it was deceptive. The bar was on the right hand side and the eating area/rooms were in the extended building to the left - so a bit of a tardis really. We ordered 2 Sunday lunches at £12 each but after 40 minutes the Manageress came over to advised that our ticket had not been put through and she'd realised we were sitting here not eating. She apologised profusely, took our order again and we waited 5 mins for it to arrive. The Sunday lunches were second to none.. full large plates of really good food. Leg of lamb meat, cooked nicely and a larger amount - roast beef both with large crispy roasted potatoes, a hugely risen Yorkshire pudding and ample baked vegetables. The food was delicious, however this is not the end... sorry no dessert as there really wasn't room after that LARGE Sunday roast and I really wanted the chocolate brownie. No the best bit was that after the apology our waitress brought over the dinners and advised us that they were on the house. We were in total shock. Yes a error had been made, but we were not expecting to get our food for free. The Manageress was straight forward, no bumbling, just plain excellent service for an error that was made right (obviously we didn't no pay for both, we offered to pay for one of them at least) Although we were juts passers-by and not regulars, we were treated with the utmost of respect and I have to say that I've only ever once before received UNCONDITIONAL customer service like this before!

100% on that and for the food. I couldn't recommend you any more than this.. I shall be back for the brownie when I am next at Anglesey Abbey or in the area.

THANK YOU.

Oh my goodness, what a find, Had searched for a veggie Sunday roast in Cambridge, and this pub came up. (Thank goodness) Very well cooked roast potatoes, delicious home made nut roast. My partner had roast lamb which he said was delicious too. Pudding was sticky toffee pudding with butter scotch sauce, Again it tasted amazing. The pub was dated, and slightly chilly, We were first in the room but it soon warmed up as it filled up! But this did not matter to us in the least. Staff friendly and very helpful, Thank you.

We had an early evening dinner for the first time at The White Swan a week ago and it was excellent in every way. There is a new owner who seems to be working really hard to refurbish the decor and judging by what he's done so far it's going to be a real treasure of a place. The menu has just the right amount of choices and we were delighted with the freshness of produce, the chef is a gem and it was such good value for the quality. It has a really friendly atmosphere, great wine and beer choices. The only negative thing I would say is that I don't live round the corner. Highly recommended and we look forward to visiting again.

Visited this pub after seeing seeing some if the fab reviews.

The food was OK, but the service was shocking.

20 minutes from when the first meal arrived to the last, and then some items weren't correct.

Some of our friends had finished their food, before others even got theirs!

The waitress was getting confused with which steak was which, luckily we all ended up with he correct meals in the end.

Drink prices were horrendous. £9.60 for two large wines

The food itself was OK, plates were hot (maybe they could tell you this before handing them to you).

Side orders were a joke, as they didn't appear until the end of the meal.

We asked for sauces but they didn't arrive until the end, the French mustard isn't really French mustard, more of a mayo combination that was disgusting.

Management blamed staffing issues, but two of them sat talking behind the bar whilst the poor waitress had to deal with everything.

All staff were grumpy, and management came across as couldn't give two tosses.

Won't be going there again, couldn't wait to get out.

Don't go if you are a large group or if your in a hurry!

Arrived for lunch having read reviews. Were seated in dining area - modern ish little atmosphere by just before 12:30. Waited for drinks. Waited maybe 20 minutes further and went to ask if we could perhaps order some food. Apologies proffered and assurance food would be with us within 30 minutes. Alarm bells should have gone off then.
Asked for Internet code. The sole waitress/bar person in charge did not know it. The landlord did not turn up till 1:00. Customers continued to be admitted and seated although the prospect of any hot food was rapidly receding.
By 1:30 no sign of food and asked again. 1:45 wrong order arrived. By then hungry cold fed up we left. Landlord blamed staff shortage but really we should have been told at the start that food would be very late and given the chance to go somewhere else. That would have been the honest option.Had the landlord actually been present it might have happened.

Dined with another couple and we all agreed it was a very pleasant pub with well cooked food. The beer selection was quite good for a small village pub and the atmosphere was fine, even though the dining side wasn't full to capacity. A small car park is behind the pub.

My only negative comment would be the menu could have just a few more dishes to choose from. Food was delicious though and the value was unbelievable.

The staff were very very helpful and pleasant (thank you very much, if you read this)

Visited the White Swan on the off chance whilst waiting to check in to local hotel.
Do not be put off by the place being small and not having up to date decor. The food was delicious.
My husband had lamb pie and I had the fish finger sandwhich, both were freshly homemade and of excellent quality at a very reasonable price
Would highly recommend to anyone wanting a good pub atmosphere and great food, a great find and if I was in the area again I would definitely return.

After giving up on driving into Cambridge due to traffic, took a detour to Stow cum Quy for a quick lunch. Based on the reviews in TA, headed for the The White Swan which is a typical British pub in a small town. Theres limited parking behind the pub which is reached via a narrow lane just past the entrance to the pub. The restaurant section looked quite nice but I chose the bar area which had limited tables and was much more casual.

Food was good and hearty but nothing really special. Service was a bit slow but probably due to the crowd inside. Nice range of local ales and spirits. All in all a very nice place to get some traditional Pub Grub after a day out in Cambridge.

There was a great range of real ales to choose from! Oakham Ales in particular caught my husband's eye, and he decided to sample the "famous" ribs to accompany his pint. The ribs deserve their reputation, fall-off-the-bone tender and absolutely delicious. That said, my goats cheese foccacia was also extremely tasty so I was happy with my choice. Lovely welcoming atmosphere and staff, I would recommend this as a pub well worth visiting.

Friends & I called in for lunch after a walk around the Anglesey Abbey area.
We were not disappointed from the welcome by the Landlady to the food which was served and on top of that a good pint from local breweries is served, We were made very welcome both by the log fire (which on this day was not needed) to the friendliness of the place - Thank you, we will be back again.

I have eaten at this English country pub, two to three times every week for the past 18 months and I have tried virtually everything on the various standard menus (weekly lunch / weekly dinner Monday / Sunday Lunch / Sunday Dinner) and most of the specials mains / deserts that regularly change. The building is divided into a restaurant and a bar. I prefer to eat in the bar because I enjoy the atmosphere and friendly banter. If we are with my elderly Father in law he prefers the quieter setting of the restaurant. The bar has 4 real ale pumps, Tribute and Ghost Ship are regular beers, there is normally an Oakham ale and a guest from a local brewery. Other Draught drinks include Guinness, Fosters, Carlsberg, krombacher and Aspall cider. The pub does not have a soda fountain so drinks are either bottled or cans. There is a good range of spirits both standard brands and premium brands. I am not a wine drinker but my Father in Law enjoys the Chilean Merlot from the pubs wine list.
Particular favorites from the daily lunch menu are the fish finger (chefs own not Birdseye!) sandwich and the burger (with added cheese / bacon /bbq sauce).
I would recommend any of the Sunday roasts, not the cheapest pub roast you will find but expertly prepared from fresh quality ingredients.
From the daily dinner menu starters, my personal favorite is the Ham hock terrine with chefs own piccalilli but the regularly changing home made soups are always excellent (and the soups are definitely prepared from fresh ingredients in the pubs own kitchen which surely is the definition of home made?) I particularly enjoyed the thick Ham and pea soup severed with a hunk of fresh soft white bread that I had yesterday evening.
From the weekly dinner menu, I would recommend the BBQ ribs, lots of meat that just falls off the bone excellent value, the fillet steak which is very reasonably priced and always cooked perfectly as ordered. My wife particularly likes the sausages and mash and the meat pies which again change regularly.
For desert, the chocolate brownie is delicious and a firm favorite with us but the sticky toffee pudding is slightly better value and equally as filling on a cold winters evening. If you are looking for a lighter desert I would recommend the mango sorbet which has almost an ice cream texture. Do not to forget to check / ask if there are any special deserts, sometimes they are not on any of the menus, this weeks Baked Vanilla Cheesecake with apple compote is so good I had a piece Tuesday and Wednesday evening and if there is fresh batch Saturday I will probably have it again!! The staff are always efficient and very friendly and make everybody feel welcome. This a real pub, run by real people rather than manged to a manual provided by a corporate brewery, serving real ales and freshly prepared quality food.

Tried out this nice village pub for lunch today. Great wooden stove. Super beer.
A simple soup, supposedly home made, was £5.50. Quality was 4 out of 10. Same for the bread. Had much better last week in a Norfolk village pub for £4.95. Pity that something simple cannot shine.

We rang The White Swan on the off chance that they could fit us in for Sunday lunch and a very friendly lady said they could. We arrived 5 minutes later to find a table had been laid for us. They were extremely busy, but we were made welcome. We all had the Sunday roast (three beef, one pork) and they were happy to make gluten free gravy for one of our party. The food was delicious; hot, good sized portions and very nicely presented. We did have to wait rather a long time for pudding, but the place was packed and very busy. We would certainly recommend The White Swan and shall return when we are next visiting the Cambridge area.
We were a party of seven, tight for time, on a Monday lunchtime. We were welcomed warmly and served appropriately quickly with lovely freshly cooked food. Our first time here but we will be back.

Lovely little pub with a great selection of seriously high standard food. Really imaginative menu with excellent veggie options. Great service and very good beer. Next time, we'll make sure we leave room for the desserts - which looked just as great as everything else.

I booked this pub/restaurant for a Sunday lunch for 8 (including teens and children) and we really enjoyed it. The food was delicious, we had free range pork, roast beef and the gammon special in our group and everyone was very impressed. Our waiter and waitress were very attentive and polite and made sure we had everything we needed. We would definitely go again.

Visiting my sister and partner so always go to their local pub. This time we visited for Sunday lunch. Delicious food and plenty of crispy roast potatoes, vegetables and gravy. All four of us ate something different and we were all very pleased with the food. Superb roast beef, pork and lamb plus the vegetarian. Scrumptious. You could not fault it.

If you want lovely food, great wines and real ale this is the pub for you.

The ribs in particular are a showstopper amongst the wonderful choice of food. Me and my boyfriend don't think we've ever had ribs so tender!

All in all a great Friday evening meal to finish a stressful week. Will definitely go back again and try some more of the menu! I think steak could be next!

Visited here recently with my wife and was really impressed with the warm friendly welcome and the outstanding food both quality and portion size. I am a big eater and I had the smoked chicken salad as a starter and my wife has the ham hock terrine both or which were absolutely fabulous. I followed with a ribeye steak, cooked medium rare with mushroom sauce and my wife had the whole plaice which was on as a special. We also had a bottle of the New Zealand Sav which was absolutely beautiful. I would definitely recommend this place. I have driven by it lots of times but nexer stopped before more's the pity.
I concur with the majority of the reviews on this site that this place is a real hidden gem, not sure why anyone would say anything else. I regularly eat in Michelin starred restaurants, rarely comment on public web sites but I thought The White Swan was really nice, its true it is not a Michelin star place but then again I think it just sets out to be a great village pub with lovely food. Keep up the good work
and thank you
Small restaurant. Had been recommended to us by a friend. Unfortunately it was not as good as we had expected. The food was a little bland and the portion sizes were small for the money.

Stopped here on the way to Newmarket races
Lovely food , very welcoming and excellent service
Fantastic home cooked food
Will call again

We visited this lovely pub with a family group.
Super atmosphere,super staff, wonderful food.
This is a great place to eat informally or more formally in the restaurant. A great local pub where you are sure of a warm welcome.
Well worth a visit.

We are always on the lookout for a pub with a welcoming landlord/lady, with less of the gastro and more of the honest and reasonable priced food, and I'm pleased to say that the recommendations on TripAdvisor of the White Swan did not disappoint. We met friends for a lunch there on a Saturday and all thoroughly enjoyed the food. The Landlady was great and the local at the bar recommending the Adnams was spot on. The White Swan do keep a lovely drop of ale. We will definitely be returning.

Probably one of the best places for Sunday lunch in Cambridge.
Have eaten here loads of times and am never disappointed, the Sunday sharing platter is amazing, always very tasty and plenty of it.
My son and his girlfriend had hangovers and didn't come with us so we asked if they could do take out, yes they did, let us a thermal box to transport it, my son was amazed there was enough food for 4 people.
I have since taken a friend and her daughter for lunch, again the food was fantastic, you also feel like your custom counts, the staff go out of their way to make sure everyone is happy.

I've visited this place now many times. I stay at a nearby hotel next to the A14 that has an excellent reputation for its food and is a quality hotel but the White Swan is a fine little pub and well worth walking from the nearby hotel. The welcome is always warm. It's a pub with a very traditional feel but what sets it apart is the quality of the food. Wholesome, hearty and very well prepared it is brought along to your table by attentive and willing staff who cannot do enough for you. This small and welcoming establishment is off the beaten track and should not be missed. Give it a go, it has never disappointed me and I'm sure it won't dissapoint you.

This is not a huge pub but the food & service is fabulous. We had lunch, there were 30 or so of us in the group & we pre ordered earlier in the morning.
I have no idea how a kitchen copes with a party but we chose from a comprehensive menu & delivery was fast. Quality was good & all thought it was great value.
This is the second time in a month we have used the White Swan & food & service was terrific both times.

Food, drink and service are all wonderful at this venue. What a treat to find it, despite living 15 miles away for so long I had never heard of this pub, yet will definitely return. Staff couldn't do enough for you and the food is presented well and is very tasty. Would recommend for families too as the next table had a child under 5 (who told the waitress his meal was "delicious!") and the staff were very accommodating.

We were on our way from Cheshire to Ipswich and turned off the A14 before Newmarket to gong somewhere to eat.
We drove around a bit and having found a nice looking Italian which was fully booked and then walked in and quickly out of a nearby local pub, we were getting a bit desperate.
Luckily we saw a sign for the Swan and thought we would stop, grab a drink and something to eat. The pub is located in a small village and has that local pub look. There is a car park at the side. If you park here then the door takes you in to the bar, which was full of locals. The decor is typical local but don't be put off.
This is a family owned pub and the welcome was friendly and efficient. The menu is varied and there was a specials menus as well.
We ordered the fish pie which was absolutely delicious and packed with fish. The couple on the next table ordered steaks and were highly complimentary about the quality of the food.
There is also a good range of beers - real ale which always helps.
We got chatting to the landlord who was very welcoming and friendly.
If you are I the area give this pub a try. Highly recommend.

This little pub doesn't look much from the outside but please don't let that put you off.
A warm welcome awaits you inside and no snooty looks from the locals who obviously use the pub a lot, a nice change.
We chose to eat in the bar and the food was fabulous, I've eaten in expensive places that weren't a patch on this !
If you in the area and fancy proper food without the price tag and much more flavour give this place a try.
I usually eat the veggie option and my butternut Wellington served on a onion and rosemary purée was so tasty and my desert a gooey fudge brownie as delicious , I am usually a bit tight with my reviews but honestly I really loved this little gem of a place.
A beautiful little village pub with a good selection of ales and a sensible, unpretentious menu. A little pricey perhaps, but you get what you pay for.

So more than 30 of us ordered lunch prior to a 3 hour walk arriving back about 12.30 am.
Service was friendly and efficient. Food was good. I had the meat pie which had slightly rubbery pastry. Those who had various sandwiches were delighted.
It is really difficult to judge food with such a large party but all in all they did a good job. It is looking a bit tired but the service is great.

We arrived for lunch after visiting a National Trust House and thought maybe this was a mistake as the decor outside and in was a little tired. Spirits were lifted when I spotted two of my favourite draught beers. The staff were delightful and although the tables could have perhaps done with a scrub the food was first rate. Sunday roast for three of us with a nut roast for the fourth with an onion and red wine gravy that was perfect with this dish. A real country pub with good food and real ales.

Have visited 'The White Swan' on a number of occasions mainly for a drink and a handful of times to eat and I am unable to fault the place. Very attentive staff, food always yummy and presented to a very high standard an a price I like. Lovely 'country pub' atmosphere which I feel caters exceptionally well for locals and in fact for all visitors. This is certainly the best pub in Stow Cum Quy and in fact the best pub around! I will be back!!

this place does what it says on the tin! the food is fantastic for the price you pay! its very pub grub but to a standard of satisfactory above the rest. the locals are very friendly and the owners are very welcoming! this place should be more popular than the rest of the competition in the village! this is a proper pub with a mixed clientele! a place that everywhere used to be!

We visited this country pub on a weekday lunchtime. The staff were very friendly and there was a more than adequate menu selection, for vegetarians as well. The food was excellent, as was the service. There was a good food of the day section
I will not hesitate to visit again when in the area.
I had read about the parking facilities but I would say that this is adequate and there is on street parking.

I have recently moved to the area and I am most pleased to say that this is my local. We bring all of our visitors to The White Swan for a really authentic pub atmosphere, surprisingly excellent food and a warm welcome from the owners and patrons.

A fantastic pub. The experience that my work colleague and I had at this pub was great. It is what you would expect of a traditional country pub. A great selection of CAMRA ales and beers just a shame I was on a business lunch! The lunch menu had a great selection and considering that the pub was busy I was promptly served and the food was exactly as I had asked for it (Crispy Bacon-Perfik!) Really made me wish I lived closer so I could visit more often. I will visit again when in the area and recommend it to all my friends that go that way. Thanks again to the two young ladies behind the bar that served well. (I believe one was the manageress – great job).

Eight of us met at the White Swan for a business meeting, previous booked. The meeting space was set out our for us and upon arrival, we were welcomed with coffee. We then chose of lunch so that it would be ready for us. We had our meeting and on the stroke of 1 o'clock as arranged, lunch was ready and served. Had to get a quick beer in first and there was a good selection from different breweries. The meal looked attractive, it was hot and tasted delicious. We thanked our hosts and booked for the next meeting.

What a great Pub,lovely food ( though like most of the places on my travels, don't take AMEX).But leaving my expense policy out of this ,it was lovely food, at a reasonable price with a good choice.But more important to me, what a lovely pub, a good range of real ales,tasters if you want,really friendly staff and customers (the landlord drove me back to my hotel ,the first time I called in).Its a real good change, if your stopping in the hotel like me, and I would recommend The White Swan to anyone who asked, I will make sure I get back there, the next time I work in the Cambridge area.Dave

We visited this establishment purely by chance on the way to Anglesea Abbey without any reservation. We were made very welcome and the range of food and drinks available were explained efficiently and with enthusiasm, especially the local real ales which is my favourite. The lovely landlady quickly offered my self and my friend tasters before we made our selection. Our wives enjoyed the wine they chose as well. All of our 4 meals were served with an appropriate wait and were superb. They all were very well cooked and presented and great value for money. We thanked the landlord and Lady and complimented them on the food and how well the beer was cared for.( I brew beer and recognise when the equipment is kept well)
We will certainly return.

We had been waiting for good weather to visit Anglesey Abbey but after looking on the NT website did not feel that the restaurant/canteen would be suitable so looked for a pub nearby.

We found The White Swan through TA and arrived just before opening time on a beautifully sunny day.
I had telephoned the day before to ensure that I could get my wife in with her wheelchair and was told it would be fine and they had a ramp if required.
On arrival we were welcomed by the landlord and his wife and seated in the bar by a sunny window.
We had intended to eat in the restaurant section but decided on the bar as it was very pleasant and more convenient and in the event we did not need the wheelchair as my wife was able to walk the few steps from the sideway into the bar.
From then on our whole experience was excellent, the food was very good, I had a homemade pork and cider pie with chips and my wife the fish pie.
Both were accompanied with side orders of vegetables which were cooked to perfection.
Being a lover of real ale I had a choice of four, local and guest beers.
The one I had was kept well.
For sweet, my wife had apple and rhubarb crumble (plenty of fruit) and I had chocolate brownie with ice cream.

The staff were all very friendly and we will not hesitate to visit again if we are in the area.

I would only make one observation, and that would be to charge more for the main courses, I felt that £9.50 for each of the main courses was very good value whereas the charge of £6.50 for the sweets felt too much for what we got.
The bill would have been the same reasonable amount of course but psychologically more satisfying if the mains were £10.50 and sweets £5.50 :)
The food is great, what a little gem to have hidden away in Cambridgeshire! Staff are great, it's a cozy little pub with some fab wines too.

We visited this pub as we were staying at the Best Western just 2 minutes down the road. From the outside we could only see the bar and were debating going in as we weren't sure it would offer the sort of food we were looking for but we couldn't have been more wrong.
