The bar area is cosy but there is a restaurant at the back that is very smart and comfortable. The food was excellent and it was obvious that everything was made from scratch from the bread to the home-made pies (which were delicious!). The service was friendly and welcoming and the meal was excellent value considering the high quality - we will definitely go back if near the area again.
Cozy pub with wood burner fire roaring away. Handy for Angelsea Abbey National Trust. Had homemade hearty soup and fresh hunk of bread Which was very tasty. Good friendly service.We will be back!

We visited after seeing the queue at the cafe at Anglesey Abbey. We had a a very nice soup they made themselves with some nice bread and a drink. The staff are very friendly and the service was excelleny.

Visited this pub/restaurant after taking friends from Bristol to see the snow drops at Anglesey Abbey. Great idea of the boss to have an advertising sign as you drive out of the Abbey and as you go through the village on your way to the A14.
Welcome was great from staff who directed us into the restaurant where we could have the bar snack menu if we chose. Got a 'beer' very quickly with a variety of true beers on offer. Ordered bar food from a very pleasant waitress. There was a specials menu available too. Even though the place was very busy, especially for a Friday lunchtime, food came very quickly and was superb. Hot, appetizing and cooked to perfection and very reasonable. £37 (plus tip) for 4 meals and 4 drinks. Well worth a visit. The patio area was not yet geared up for summer, only smokers. No doubt that will happen within the next few weeks.

We are regular visitors to the Swan,on this occasion we were an unusual Valentines group as there was 6 of us!
The White Swan never disappoints,the friendly welcome,lovely warm welcoming bar and fantastic food. Super choice and great vegetarian options.
Nothing is too much trouble. A great place to meet old friends and make new ones.
Well done the White Swan team.

We did some research before making a table reservation at The White Swan as we are retired and have all the time in the world.
The restaurant is attached on one side of the pub and kept separate from the bar area on the other side.
Nice cosy atmosphere in a small restaurant with comfortable seating.
The menu was ample enough for us to choose a dish and I opted for Fish and Chips as I had had steak the previous evening.My wife chose the fish pie which she enjoyed.For dessert we both chose the sticky toffee pudding which we both enjoyed.
We both enjoyed the evening and thought that the food was of a high standard and the two young ladies serving were friendly and professional.

weeks ago for a family meal for three for Sunday lunch. We arrived and to start with there is simply no parking anywhere. Which sometimes happens in country pubs, if you don't mind parking in a tight country road it's fine.
Well, apparently they had over booked! We were asked if we wanted to eat in the bar, a small bar full of people, tiny tables, busy room with lots of people wandering around, it's a bar after all, not what we had booked
A small pub with big food flavours, really good quality dishes from ribs to pies and many others, these are well thought out dishes, we've been numerous times and have never been disappointed yet.
Very tasty home cooked pub food washed down with good beer. The staff were wonderfully friendly. The decor needs updating though. Great place for a no fuss lunch.

We were going to head into the city but thought better of it, my wife suggested we try here and we were suitably impressed. The menu was very broad and all dishes we chose were very well prepared and freshly cooked. My only comment is the place is somewhat basic, paper napkins, quite sparsely furnished and lacks the finishing touches to make it a serious contender as a 'real' eatery!! With a bit more effort on the presentation front it could well be up there with the high end places in the immediate area and the food we had tonight was as good as; if not even better than the rather pretentious places nearby..!! Jolly good value too, we ate nearby recently and the bill for my wife and I was more expensive than the meal we had for 5 tonight..!!!! I'll be going back very soon. Well done.

We needed something to fill up on before a night out and we couldn't have been made more welcome. We got the last table in the corner of the bar and got our lovely fish and chips 15 minutes before the kitchen was due to open. The chips were especially gorgeous. Thank you so much

Four of us dropped in unannounced on Tuesday lunchtime. We were cold and wet so the fire in the corner was appreciated, as was the warm welcome we received.
We got our food order in early which was just as well because the bar filled rapidly, with many customers wanting food (a good sign).
Our food came after a little wait and it was excellent.
This pub has had a chequered history and previous incumbents have failed to offer a consistent service. The present team seem to be on the ball - long may it continue.

Nice little family-run (apparently) pub and bar, with a restaurant to the other side of the building. Lovely place for a bite of lunch on a cold, rainy day. Local beers (plus some big names) on tap. Excellent roasted-parsnip soup. Folks at the next table ordered sandwiches, which came with the most beautiful chips (fries) I've ever seen. Must go back. Nice people, fine service, very accommodating. Much better than a particular Greene King chain pub just up the road. (The White Swan is a bit plain on the outside, but don't let that put you off.)

Six of us sat down and had delightful, large starters, all were completely enjoyed, the main meals were very well cooked, very tasty and the plates totally cleared. The puddings were really great too, all served with a smiley waitress. We will certainly go there again. I believe very well priced too.

We were staying a the Quy Mill Great Western that was located a mile away from here. We decided that we wanted some good 'pub grub' for dinner and we definitely received this. The food was lovely! But in particular the pub has a warm, friendly atmosphere and provided fantastic service.

Dads 81st birthday meal with family. Assorted meals all really good. Pork Chop especially good. Atmosphere friendly the waitress was really good. It was her first time waitressing but she was excellent!

Convened here as central to family members and enjoyed a very good meal, the food was well cooked and served with a friendly smile. I enjoyed the venison steak which was cooked perfectly and accompanied by some chorizo. After a starter and main course most of us had to bypass the puddings and go straight to the coffees, although the puddings that were ordered looked tasty and were enthusiastically finished. Good ale, good food in nice surroundings no better way to enjoy a family Friday evening. Happily make a return visit.

Ordered the ribeye steak with peppercorn sauce, Unfortunately the steak was grisly and the peppercorn sauce was watery and tasted chemically. There were 5 steaks ordered for our party and only one of them was a good cut. The waitress was extremely helpful and friendly.

Went there as it was recommended as a sister pub of the The Brunswick in Cambridge, which is highly rated but currently closed. The ambience struck us as somewhat down market, but could have been forgiven if the food had been great. The waitress was new and very sweet. 100% for trying at giving good service., ....but the food! What a shocker. The grilled goats cheese looked as if it was microwaved. Edible, but certainly nothing to write home about. At this point we started to wonder. The menu was brief. Great we thought, they concentrate on doing a few things very well. Far from! My wife never returned a dish before in her life, but the watery tasteless vegetable soup served as pie was too much.

After the meal we found out that the White Swan and The Brunswick have parted their ways. Kind of explains it, but doesn't bring back a ruined evening.

The Michelin guide tells you when it is worth to go out of your way to visit a restaurant. This one deserves to go out of your way to avoid it.
Really enjoyed my meal and a pint. Great staff. The "pulled pork" pie was one of the best I have had. Highly recommended. Was serving up till 9pm in the week. I will be going back.

We called in for lunch on a wet bank holiday Monday and had a really good meal with good beer.
The pub was quite busy and there was a beer festival going on in the car park with a chap playing guitar and singing.
Our food came quickly and was really good. I had a burger and my wife had the bacon and brie ciabatta and both were very tasty. Our friends had a burger and an aubergine bake which were also good. The beer was excellent and the pub sells Becks blue non alcoholic lager which kept our driver (me) happy.
The service was welcoming and friendly.
A very nice pub which also had the air of being a really friendly local.

Stopped by for dinner after visiting Anglesey Abbey. The food was really good. I can recommend the beef and Guinness pie and the sea bass special. We decided to sit in the bar for a more informal atmosphere and the staff were very friendly and helpful.

Headed here on Sunday after a visit to Anglesey Abbey. Only the Sunday roast menu available so cant comment on other foods but the Sunday roast was AMAZING, I had the roast pork and my husband the roast beef. Both were absolutely delicious and very good portions. Staff were very friendly and attentive. Service very quick even though the restaurant was quite busy.
All very reasonably priced!
We'll definitely be going back when we are back in the area.

It was avery hot lunchtime, but I still went for the steak all and mushroom pie, as this is one of my yardsticks for judging a pub lunch. The White Swan passed with flying colours. The whole meal was delicious.

The bar staff are very friendly and helpful and wouldn't hesitate to recommend.

Lovely village setting where you can walk through fields of corn food is good as well with a good selection of real ale. Lamb with dipping breads starter for me, goats cheese followed by swordfish for my wife, very nice. Staff very helpful too.

On a Sunday evening not easy to find a local pub that serves food. However, the Sunday Evening Menu was quite extensive and the meal was freshly cooked, obviously from raw ingredients and was absolutely super served by lovely friendly staff. Not overly expensive and best of all, dog friendly in the bar. The best steak ever and good ales. Certainly a return visit soon.

I live next door to this pub and to be honest ive only dined here twice but food is good and the chef lucas is talented the landlord gerry is a nice guy but ii almost a recluesive figure but never mind you cant have every thing
Fantastic customer service, brilliant atmosphere & fantastic food; desserts were amazing, & very reasonably priced.

There is a big choice of food, our two dishes had fresh ingredients. I can recommend the local sausages and mash with 3 choices of mash, 3 gravies and 2 sausages - I had 2 venison and 1 pork; absolutely delicious. My wife had a large fish and chips. All the food being delivered to our and other tables smelled great. Good choice of Real Ales, with 3 hand pulls of different styles. Nice friendly staff in a lovely village pub. #1 choice for me in this area.

Traditional English village pub with a warm welcome from friendly staff. It is a free house and has four real ales on tap which are continually changing. They have a board above the bar displaying the ales that are in the cellar settling for the following days. The restaurant serves generous portions of "pub" food plus a few surprises which are prepared from good quality fresh ingredients to a very high standard. Definitely worth a visit.

We chose this country village pub pretty much at random and, with 4 adults, 2 teenagers and 3 kids descending for lunch we did book in advance. The menu had variety, suited all tastes, all our petty little requests (bit more of this, bit less of that, etc) were met with a cheerful 'no problem'. The pies were inventive, tasty and home made, the presentation of all our meals was excellent. But it is the no fuss but efficient service and the ability to be flexible which makes this pub stand out for me. We were well fed and well looked after - ticks all the boxes for me.

Decided at the last minute to have some lunch on the way back from shopping trip and had heard good things about this pub.

As soon as we walked in we were made to feel very welcome. Upon ordering nothing was too much trouble. We had a the fish finger ciabatta and goats cheese ciabatta.

Both very nice and will be going back to try the Sunday roasts which we have been recommended to us.

We'd just been to Anglesey Abbey and didn't fancy the NT food. Found this pub and had an excellent lunch with a very unusual but excellent crumble banana, pistachio and rhubarb (I think) accompanied with a crème anglais flavoured with cardamom.

Recommended highly

We stopped here for Sunday lunch after a walk with the dog. I had the roast lamb and my wife had the nut roast, both were absolutely spot on, one of the best Sunday lunches I've had in a long time, the gravy on both meals was certainly the best gravy I've had anywhere.

Staff were very friendly and welcoming and even brought a bowl of water for our dog. Excellent service and a great selection of real ales.

Highly recommended!

Went here the night before my friends wedding. She highly recommended and it was lovely.
Really cute quiant pub in a lovely village setting.

Must have the pie it was probably the best pie I have ever had. My wife had the sausage and mash they have fancy gravy but she is pregnant so chef made a plain one. And you must have the ice cream it was very yummy. So I would say a must try if in the area thank for a good meal.

My friend and I had a lovely day at the Spa in Quy and we're starving when we left. We quickly checked online if the White Swan serves food on a Saturday night and went straight away. We stayed in the bar area and it was lovely. The atmosphere is like a real local pub and you feel very welcome. I had only been once before and I remember that I really enjoyed it then too. People are friendly, the menu is really nice and the food not only tastes very nice, it is also presented very nicely. I know that the owners also run the Brunswick in town and I'm looking forward to giving that a go. It's so nice to get a nice home cooked meal (I had a vegetarian pie and my friend had the fish pie followed by apple-strudel). I even asked for a take away dinner for my other half as the food was so nice. All in all I can just say, try for yourself, chances are you won't be disappointed!

The line-up of cask ales in this family-run free house usually includes the lovely citrusy JHB from Oakham Brewery alongside Adnams, Woodfordes and one or two more obscure names. They are all carefully looked after of course; they really care about beer at the White Swan.
The food is superb - top restaurant standard but much more affordable. Last night my friend and I both chose what turned out to be an amazing dish: medallions of wild boar fillet (served delightfully pink) with a caramelised onion and wild mushroom bread and butter pudding, green beans and a fabulously rich juniper gravy. Amazing! Those diners who chose from a wide selection of home-made pies were equally delighted and the cheeseboard was excellent too.
There was a great atmosphere in the pub which was populated by a good balance of dedicated locals and visitors. And, best of all, there was none of that ghastly canned music!
The toilets were spotless and we were even offered a lift home by a staff member at the end of the evening. It doesn't get much better!

We arrived at midday without booking and were seated in the bar area, right by a cosy log burner. The staff could not have been friendlier to us or our two young children with our meals arriving promptly. The portion sizes (2 adult, 2 kids) were very generous, and very good value. Just a shame that we had no room for some very tempting deserts.

Looks like just a standard pub from the outside, inside is a very warm welcome .
We went here as we were meeting a friend and this was in the middle of both destinations.

Arrived early 5.30pm, but they didn't serve food until 6pm, so we ordered drinks, sat down, a lovely friendly lady came over with the menus and a specials board and said that as soon as we had decided she would put the order through.

They food arrived was amazing, better than most restaurants that I have eaten in, the presentation was a work of art and it all tasted delicious.

I would recommend this pub and can not wait to go again.

Myself, my husband, my 3 young children, my mother and father in law and 2 of their friends came here to eat on the 1st Jan. I rang before we came to ask if my 5 month old puppy chihuahua was allowed in as well and they said yes, but just in the bar area which was fine.
We all sat down and ordered our food which we thought was a tad expensive (£11.50 for fish and chips) and had to wait a very long time for it to come out even though they were not busy. We asked for 3 child portions of fish and chips but only got 2, my young daughter received a adult size. We mentioned it as the lady brought it out and also when she took the plates away. Her reply was 'well it has all been eaten hasn't it?' What she should have said was 'sorry and of course you will not be charged for a adult size portion' but customer service didnt seem to be her strong point.
I took my puppy outside every 15 minutes to see if he needed the toilet but on the occassions I took him out he didnt. Then as I was in conversation my 8 year old son noticed he needed to go and went to take hom outside but the owner started to stroke our puppy by the door which stopped my son from taking him ot for a few seconds, by which this point our puppy had started to go to the toilet (number 2 unfortunately). BUT it was only 2 small bits and I very quickly took him outside to finish and my daughter picked the poo up from the mat by the door. As I was outside with the puppy while he finished, the lady owner snapped at me to get back inside to clear it up as it was upsetting all her customers (there was only about 4 people in there apart from us) and we had just spend alot of money with them!
When I went back in the man owner was cleaning it up and ranting and raving about the dog 'crapping everywhere' and how we hadnt apologised! I apologised myself 3 times to which his reply was a grunt.
I would like to point out that he was a puppy chihuahua so would hardly crap everywhere. Just a note, do not leg dogs in your pub unless you can expect and accept the odd accident. Your reaction was unecessary, rude and shocking. My children were upset by what happened and we just all sat there when we got home, gobsmacked. We had a lovely stay at the Missing Sock which is just up the road and was very sad to have ended it as it did at your pub.

Had lunch here last Saturday on the way to a birthday party in the area. Really impressed by the friendly service, which was very quick. We all ordered steak and agreed that it was one of the best steaks any of us had ever eaten. Moist, juicy, perfectly cooked and well priced. The chips were double-cooked I think and they were lovely. We had no room for dessert sadly! We'll definitely be back.

I visited the White Swan with friends on a Saturday evening, having pre-booked.

The staff are welcoming, the food is reasonably priced and the atmosphere is good. My only gripes are that, although our order for drinks was taken promptly, it took at least twenty minutes for them to be delivered to our table. I think this was because the waitress was doubling up on the bar. We also had to ask for the complimentary olive board, which is offered to parties who have pre-booked and then had to enjoy this as quickly as possible because our food was ready to be served up.

A nice place but pre-booking at the weekend is, I think, a must. Be prepared to adopt the continental style and have long waits between courses too!

The veggie nut roast was spot on and the lamb was a generous and well-cooked portion. Great vegetable s and yorkshire puds. Chocolate Brownie was to die for! Shame about the decor as it has a dated feel. A quick spruce and this would be a great place to come for any occasion.

Booked to hold a meeting here and was heartily welcomed. We arrived to have our meeting, and booked the meal at the start for later. Premises very clean and welcoming; staff exceptional and the food just marvellous. Well prepared and presented and tasted - just great! Food from 12 mid-day onwards. Thank you Martin. We are now looking forward to our next meeting - yes same place! A14 road just off at junction 35 and a few miles from Anglesey Abbey. Combine the two for a great day out.

Unpretentious pub with friendly landlady and staff. God range of unteresting beers including wherry, jhb. Food was more interesting than ecpected and the potato wedges were a meal on their own and very irresistable. Yum! Thank you.
Nice pub full of nice people. It is good that it stays open late (about 2am) for the people who want to carry on the night but not to a club.

We came in on the back of previous good reviews. Booked online for a tuesday and was surprised to find the place full (turns out there was a quiz but the restaurant was fairly full too). Opted for bar menu and had a steak pie and fish and chips, both were just awesome. Although we waited we were given free olives as we'd booked which was a nice touch

It's always reassuring to see a menu with only a handful of choice dishes. The smoked fish tureen was excellent, as I'm told was the rack of lamb, fish and chips and lamb pie. My steak was a bit chewy, but given that everyone else loved their food, including the kids, we will certainly be coming back soon.

Called in on a Monday night at 8.00pm. Restaurant had just two diners but the chef kindly agreed to preapre meals for three of us. Staff were attentive and freindly, food was reasonably priced and tasty and there was a good selection of beer. Sadly , as with so many pubs, it was quiet on this night, but if you are looking for a pub that looks the part and seems like it could get lively at the weekends, then give it a go.
The White Swan is a very friendly local pub with a welcoming landlord and staff. There menu is better than the average pub and the food is affordable. A popular bike tour stop.

Another excellent and enormous roast at Quy. We come back here for the sharing platter whenever we go out for Sunday lunch for the huge portions on lamb, beef and pork, plus the giant Yorkshire pudding. Highly recommended. Very high quality house red too this week. I'd also recommend the boozy Irish coffee afterwards. Big thumbs up to The White Swan again.

Decided to have Sunday lunch on our way back from Anglesey abbey. Good choice, the beef and lamb were both great in taste and value the cheesecake was a delight. Staff were polite and attentive.
Decor a little tired but looks to be work in progress!

Will be visiting again but next time with the grandchildren so be warned!!!

Found the pub on tastecard and looked worth a trip out to SCQ.
I shouldnt have bothered .
Despite taking my booking in the restaurant when i arrived i was offered bar menu only as they had a beer festival on in the garden.
When i complained they produced another menu which was still poor and nothing like they advertise on their website.
It was hugely irritating and a waste of my time as we left without eating.
One member of staff was very sweet and clearly embarassed by the whole affair, whereas the lady who held herself out to be the owner seemed a bit nonplussed by it all and offered nothing other than a shrug and a cursory sorry about that.
I wont be going back.

Staying in the area we saw the reviews of the restaurant and decided to give it a try. We were not disappointed. We opted for starters, I had the goats cheese salad and my husband had the salmon with a dill and caper sauce. Both were tasty and well presented.
For main course I decided on the sausages and chose the grain mash with the sherry and onion sauce. I was very glad I did as it was delicious. I had a side dish of season vegetables and onion rings. My husband chose the home made burger served with hand cup chips and home made salsa. He was impressed.
I didn't have room for a dessert but my husband had spotted the bread and butter pudding on the menu and was determined to sample it at all costs. He said that it was the best he had tasted.
The service was prompt and both the waitress and the landlord were chatty and friendly. I would definitely recommend anyone in the area to give it a try, you won't be disappointed!

Restaurant -Haddock was extremely good and tasted very fresh, chips were excellent - the peas served in a jug found a bit odd and unnecessary? My husband had the pork loin/belly - loin was bland, belly was delicious - sauce OK but only a tablesponful served in a little bottle. Smoked mash? (not quite sure what to expect!) he found a bit off putting and not very nice - mustard or apple would have been nicer with the pork.When we arrived we had to wait a few minutes while 3 people behind the counter were trying to sort out which tables were going where when there was only 3 other people in the restaurant. However the waitress brought our menus straight away but when reading out the specials forgot to mentioned the sea bass. Ordered some wine which she brought but sat there for 10 minutes and had to ask for the wine glasses as she had forgotten. Wine was very good and reasonably priced.. The ambience of the restaurant could possibly be improved -on the table were small tumblers for water and no wine glasses which gave the impression more of a cafe than a restaurant as did the chairs. The bar had a lovely atmosphere. We will return sometime in the future I'm sure!

We meet friends here for Sunday lunch just before christmas and it was lovely - I would say there is not much choice on the meat menu for the lunch - I like chicken and turkey but they only had Beef or Pork on the menu. I had the pork and must say even though im not a fan of pork it was very nice. Staff were friendly and it was very resonably priced !
Lovely pub but £4.90 for a bottle of magners!!! Shame, won't go back! Much cheaper pubs nearby which are just as nice.

We came in on the back of previous good reviews. Booked online for a tuesday and was surprised to find the place full (turns out there was a quiz but the restaurant was fairly full too). Opted for bar menu and had a steak pie and fish and chips, both were just awesome. Although we waited we were given free olives as we'd booked which was a nice touch

I have popped in before a couple of times but I finally decided to begin writing reviews!

This is one of my favourite pub/ restaurants in Cambridge. The food is excellent, I've never been disappointed. It always seems to be busy but I always get my food relatively quickly. Staff are always really friendly, though they all seem to know me by now!

I couldn't recommend this place enough. Can't wait for my next visit!

Four of us stopped at the White Swan for light lunch, three ciabatta with hot fillings and a jacket potato. We were still waiting for these over an hour later, despite the pub being almost empty. When the food eventually arrived, the potato had to be sent back because the flesh was brown which should have been seen when the potato was cut open in the kitchen. An alternative was chosen of a chicken caesar salad which arrived after the ciabattas had been eaten. This was inedible, the chicken was still raw in the middle - as the chicken had been silced, this should have been seen in the kitchen, the salad comprised of three outer leaves of lettuce, one of which was yellow.

The ciabatas were adequate but one was described in the menu as containing toasted peppers with hummus but was actually peppers and brie. It was fortunate that the person who chose this was not dairy intolerant.

The only credit I can give to the White Swan is the way that the manager dealt with our complaints but this is offset by the thought that food of such poor quality should never have been allowed to leave the kitchen.
Reasonable food but over priced.Large party booked but tables split.Should have been made aware of this when booked.

Dined here for Easter Sunday lunch with family on strength of reviews and reputation, wish we had gone elsewhere. Food ok, nothing more than average. Meat was either overcooked i.e. pork and beef was very rare (we were not advised of this), vegetables were warm and gravy a little cold. Yorkshire puddings had been cooked to the point of death in places but were stodgy in others. Plates were also cold which didnt help. Starters of soup and smoked salmon were ok but portions were small and soup lacked flavour. Beer according to male members of our party was good. We did remark that food was cold on 2 occasions and were advised that the "kitchen would be told" and chef "cuts the meat at half hourly intervals", not quite sure what they meant by that and couldnt be bothered to ask them to explain. To be honest it was below average but cant score anything other than poor and at least wine and beer were nice. Not cheap for a Sunday lunch and expected a lot more!

Arrived just before 7 pm and restaurant was empty. I never like to go into an empty restaurant but i needn't have worried. It wasn't long before several other diners arrived and there was a great atmosphere. The waitress was great, attentive without being intrusive. The food surpassed my expectations, which were already high based on reviews on here. I had sirloin with a mushroom sauce and my partner had crunch topped rack of lamb. Both were excellent. For dessert we both had bread and butter pudding. An old favourite. My cousin was a chef and his b&b pudding is hard to beat but the chef at the white swan took this old favourite to new heights.

Good choice of wines and great coffee completed an excellent dining experience. Highly recommended.

I have been to this quaint village pub for Sunday lunch 3 times now, and I really can't fault it. Good value, very tasty food, and pleasant service. It does get busy so booking is reccomended.
Unfortunately I haven't tried anything from their regular menu, but hope to soon, if it's anything like their Sunday lunches!
As I have always drove to this pub, it is nice to see that they have a good selection of non alcholic beers (as well as a good stocked bar for those not driving!)
For a good Sunday lunch, deffinitely give it a go!

First dinner here and we were not disappointed. The menu was a delightful combination of traditional favourites and other more experimental flavours. The fish and the steak were exceptional, as were the sausages and home made burgers .Enjoyed the wine too. Only criticism was the room temperature, it was one of the coldest weeks of the year however. But will certainly be adding this local gastro pub to my list of favourites.

The White Swan is a village pub close to Anglesey Abbey(NT). The beer from Adnams and Woodfordes, red and white wines by the glass were good. I was pleased to see two Englsh whiskies from the St. George's Distillery in South Norfolk were stocked, alongside Scottish Malts.The lunchtime food from the Seasonal Bar Menu and Lite Bite Menu were disappointing. We had a long wait of about 40 minutes for our order to arrive. A small helping of pork belly was £13.50! A small burger and chips cost £8.95, and the steak ciabatta appeared to contain a thin slice of dry roast beef, just warmed up. A selection of three different sausages with mash and gravy was OK. A let down by the kitchen both in timing and quality. A slimmer menu with less choice but better food would be a good idea. The staff were very friendly and helpful, and we had apologies for our long wait. Our second round of drinks were not charged for - a decent gesture!

We had had a lovely morning strolling in uncharacteristically bright winter sunshine in Anglesey Abbey and chanced upon this pub as we were driving away home.
We sat in the front bar, unaware of the restaurant at the rear, but ordered from a specials as well as a permanent menu. We had to wait nearly 40 minutes for our order and the staff seemed quite overwhelmed, but very friendly and helpful all the same. I ordered a vegetarian mille feuille aubergine and pepper with goats cheese arrangement, others ordered pork, game pie and caesar salad. Unconventional-looking but all tasty. Bread and butter pudding was served in a very bright yellow sauce which was creamy and tasty, but no idea what made it so yellow! Yes, we were glad to sit and chat together, but would have had to leave if we were clock-watching. Take your time and relax as the wait is well rewarded.

We went there on a Sunday lunchtime after a lovely walk. The only choice on the menu for nonvegetarians was a Sunday roast. Three of us were tempted by the beef as it was described as pink and medium rare. In fact it was far from pink although edible if you like your beef well done. The yorkshire pudding however was not just well done but cremated. If I had burnt yorkshire puddings at home like this they would have gone in the bin and not on the plate! The roast potatoes were pale and soggy and could have done with the cooking that the meat and yorkshire pudding had been exposed to. The roast vegetables were also uninspiring. On a positive note the side vegetables were lovely and my vegetarian daughter had a lovely meal of stuffed mushroom. The chocolate brownie we had for pudding was very acceptable and the service was effiecient and friendly. Maybe Sunday is a bad day to eat at the White Swan unless you enjoy a roast lunch.

We were a party of 9 and only booked on the day, so were very pleased that the restaurant was able to accommodate us (especially as the reviews on Trip Advisor were so good).

We were told that another large group were arriving just before us, so were pleased to be seated straight away and had our orders taken as soon as we were ready. The staff were very friendly and helpful. We were given a restaurant menu and a bar menu and there were some specials on the black board.

Across the group we ordered a mixture of starters and main courses. The starters got a mixed reception. The root vegetable soup (of the day) was very peppery (possibly just over seasoned) and the pork rillettes were basically pork pate (a little disappointing given the lavish description in the menu). However a sausage and mash starter (not on the menu but kindly made specially) was really good. My wife had the caesar salad and was surprised by the poached and deep fried egg (although this is what is says in the menu), but it was very fresh.

The main courses were a mix across fish and chips, burgers, game pie and the vegetarian option. The fish was good and there were no complaints from the burger eaters. The game pie was ok, but a little surprised no vegetables were supplied as well (there were some carrots in the pie). Some gravy on the side with the pie would also have been appreciated.

Desserts were good, with a selection of lemon sorbet and the chef's sharing chocolate assiette. The espresso was very bitter

The real ale and wine we had with the meal was OK as well, but nothing to write home about to be honest

So, nice venue, friendly staff, and some nice food offset by other average to poor dishes. I hope to visit again sometime soon and will try some of the other dishes. I wish the team at the White Swan well and hope they will take the comments in this review in the spirit they are meant.
had two visits to the Swan now and both times have been impressed with the standard of food served,would recommend Tony

Booked table for husband,myself,daughterand teenage grandson at 12.30today. As we entered the restaurant the freezing cold air hit you. After half hour a waitress lit the fire and the candles and put the lights on the tree. It was as if we had not been there. Another elderly diner sat with coat and scarf on. Ordered soup as to get warm. Soup so hot it was almost boiling. My burnt mouth still hurts. The main came and my beef was stone cold and the teaspoon of gravy under it. Also the veg, only warm item was roast potatoes. Other three meals luke warm. Asked for more gravy in the hope it would warm it up and the smallest gravy boat I've ever seen arrived. Only one for four meals. Decided we had had enough and did not order sweet, but I asked for a pot of tea and my daughter a coffee. My tea arrived but no milk and the piece of fudge missing from my daughters. My husband had to go and ask for the milk. When I went to pay I started to tell them about the meal but the waitress just laughed and said 'oh dear - the room too cold and the soup too hot. ' This was accompained by a sarcastic laugh which I and my family did not find funny. She also said that yes the room was cold (no apology) when we arrived but they didnt know how long it would take to heat up. It was now 2.30pm and the room was hot. It was such a shame as we had eaten here before and it was good but I will never set foot in the place again.

Although the centre of Cambridge might have good restaurants I was very hard pressed to find anything worth a visit on the outskirts, especially as it was Sunday night. So, I was pleased to find that the White Swan, close to the A14 and only a few minutes away from Cambridge, does do food - very good food - on Sunday nights. It is a bar menu, but the chef had also come up with some very tempting specials. I opted for home made soup and then home made pie. Both were quality dishes, very freshly produced and tasty and were presented attractively and piping hot - though I do prefer my pie on the plate rather than in an individual dish. Although I was on my own in the restaurant the staff were very friendly and considerate.
What impressed me equally, was the jolly, friendly chap on the phone when I made my booking.
I very much look forward to another visit.

We went for Sunday lunch there and as 2 of our group were vegetarians we all tried the vegetarian Sunday roast and it was delicious, the service was excellent, even bring us an extra helping of gravy, the Yorkshire pudding were huge and tasty. It was quite filling but there was still room to try their bread and butter pudding with a twist...their custard had cardamoms in it to give it a hint of something more exotic and the bread and butter pudding also had apricots....delicious! we were happily stuffed by the end of the meal and needed a long walk across Quy fen to walk it off. We will be back!

I stayed at the Best Western in Stow Quy in early October for work. Although a very nice atmosphere it lacked a personal feel and you just felt like a room number, so began my search for a decent evening meal and drink. I ended up spending 4 nights at the White Swan (it would have been 5 but a friend dragging me into Cambridge.

Don't get me wrong, I love sampling different restaurants and am not a creature of habit but after the first night at the Swan I was compelled to try as much of the menu as I possibly could! The food here is very good indeed and I like to think my standards are high! The Pork belly was devine as was the fish and chips and sausage and mash where you could choose the sausage, mash and sauce combination to suit your tastebuds. The highlight for me was Steak night where you get a free starter or dessert if you order one if the gorgeous steaks on offer.

They also have very good knowledge of their wine and Martin picked a perfect red to accompany my steak but what also makes a meal here pretty damn good is the price. For the standard of food and drink it's very reasonable, gastro pub food and drink at normal pub prices (maybe I am too used to London bills)

To top this all off is the fantastically warm welcome and feel from this family run establishment. It didn't take long for me to feel like I had been going there for years. I got a taxi service back to my hotel from the very knowledgeable and very welcoming Gerry who was one of the nicest pub landlords I have ever known and I wish them all the best with their business as I am sure a lot of sweat, blood and tears go behind trying to make their pub a success.

All I would say is give this place a go! I would love to have this pub as my local and hope to maybe visit again.
Excellent steak, excellent sauce, excellent service, excellent beer Happy people, highly recommended

We are new to this region only here for a few days, had a wonderful meal great service and really good value, very homely atmosphere with top class food would def recommend and if in area again no hesitation in coming back well done.

Second visit to the White Swan since it last changed hands and frankly this is exactly the kind of place I want to go to. 4 real ales, decent bar and restaurant menu, happy people and a chef in the kitchen that can actually cook (makes a refreshing change). The blend one wants to see, a real pleasant place to go. I wish the staff and owners every success. Shame we live 30 miles away!

I have now eaten twice at the White Swan. I like the place very much. The first time, I had the best steak and kidney pie that I have ever eaten. Now, yesterday I tried the fish and chips. Really very good. Finally I asked for an Iced Latte which was not on the menu. After explaining what I wanted they came up with exactly what I was after. Very refreshing indeed. I suggested they add it to their menu.
I will definitely eat there again, the next time that I am visiting Cambridge and the vicinity.

My husband and I booked table here to celebrate my birthday as it looked like it might have been a great plae to eat. However, we were very disappointed. To start with we were late sitting down because the waiter "was stressed out" as restaurant was busy (it's tiny though!). The starters were fine with lots of flavour and not bad value for money however out main courses arrived and they weren't much bigger than a starter. We both ordered dishes that came with seasonal vegetables, these seasonal vegetables consisted of 3 carrots each. Whilst the food was all very pleasant it was very overpriced. The service was very poor, no one came to see if our meals were okay and when we asked for more drinks and some water we felt as if we were wrong for asking for more drinks and if we were being an inconveniene. We didn't bother with dessert just asked for the bill and left. £50 well and truly wasted and left still hungry!

Have eaten here twice over the last month and both times have been excellent.

First time was a quiet romantic meal and we both enjoyed the friendly service and good quality food - the seabass in particular was perfect.

Second time was for a Birthday and we took the kids. Lots of options on the menu for fussy eaters. They really worked hard to accommodate some of the off menu kids requests (cheesy mash!).

It's great to have found somewhere local that serves fresh, good quality food with a good choice of beers.

Recommended without hesitation.

We had a family reunion there on Saturday and had a fabulous meal. The service was excellent - nice friendly staff and could not fault the food or service. Superb presentation of food and generous portions - top quality. They do not yet have good disabled facilities but am sure this will come as they are trying so hard to make it a pub for everyone.
Well worth a visit and the best pub in the area.
The M family

Called in on spec after a visit to Anglesey Abbey where we were greeted on arrival and told that the restaurant was full, but a table in the bar was free. I has decided what to eat before even being shown a menu as a couple at an adjacent table were tucking into thick slices of pink roast beef. My roast lunch exceeded expectations - the generously sliced beef was tasty and tender and flanked not only by a massive Yorkshire pudding and roast potatoes, but also by swede, parsnip, carrots and sweet potatoes, all seasoned and roasted, with a side dish of freshly steamed vegetables. Staff were attentive and friendly and delivered second to none service. Certainly the best pub food I have eaten in a long time and would not hesitate in recommending The White Swan for both quality and service.

What more could you want - the food really was outstanding and very reasonable given the quality - emphasis on fresh with neat twists - we had pork belly with a tasty mash, and battered fish which bore no resemblance to chip shop fare, the fish just melted in the mouth. Overall this is the best food I have had in the local area and we will be returning again soon even though we are from the other side of the county - in fact in the next one.

The White Swan is a tiny pub which has suffered from being tucked away in a small dormitory village and has changed hands a couple of times. The pub is minutes from the A1303 /A14 East Cambridge interchange if you know where to look but there aren't a lot of reasons to visit Quy

Outwardly the pub looks little different, but the new team have put a lot of effort into the menu and drinks range . Real ales included well kept Oakhams and Cannon beers and a farm bottled Normandy beer . We've been twice and eaten in restaurant and bar. Best restaurant dish - the shared sampler pudding plate , best bar dish the perfect home made burger. Usually the idea of a burger is far more satisfying than the reality.

I'd actually give the bar food a 5 and the restaurant a 4 because while Cambridge has plenty of fine dining restaurants, it's hard to find pub food that's more than just pleasant.

The White Swan is a traditional village real ale Free House which has recently changed ownership and is now being run by Gerry Skews and family. We went to dinner there on Good Friday and thought it was brilliant! Our host in the restaurant was Martin who provided a really excellent, friendly and attentive level of service without being overbearing. He was well-informed about all the food and drink on offer and went out of his way to ensure that one of our party, who is currently expecting, had all her questions answered with regards to the suitability of different items on the menu.

The food was all fresh, tasty and really well-prepared. We saved room for dessert and I can highly recommend the mixed assiette that we sampled on the night. We went for beer over wine with our meal (although there was a bottle of Italian red on offer that we will definitely be going back to try) and the Norman Gold was a real find – brewed in Northern France by an English gent, they will be offering other bottled beers from the range in the near future. Also on the pumps were Woodforde’s Wherry, Oakham’s JHB, Adnams Southwold Bitter and another real ale whose name escapes me for now.

After a thoroughly enjoyable evening, we had a quick chat to Gerry, the owner, on our way out. He asked for our feedback and we suggested a few minor cosmetic changes. Gerry said that the team had decided to concentrate on getting the food and drink right first as the rest would follow. They’re right of course and what’s more, they’re well on their way. We’d heartily recommend an evening in the White Swan (they do a bar menu too), even if it means we have to book further in advance next time!

We stayed at the Best western Mill up the road, but after checking the reviews on Tripadvisor, decided to eat here instead. We were glad that we did, as it was at least as good as the prvious reviews have said. The landlord and landlady, are most helpful, (giving us directions to the Cambridge Ultralase for the next day-don't go to Ultralase). The atmosphere is most welcoming, and the food is of gourmet standard. We had a quick chat with the Chef (Paul) who was a fantastic guy, with a weatlth of worldwide experience. Don't be put off by the average looking exterior of this Pub, go in and sample what they have to offer, you won't be disappointed. You also won't be ripped off as the prices are very reasonable for the standard of food and drink on offer.

Visited by chance and a really good meal; fresh food, an imaginative well cooked dish and friendly service. Tried a beer that was new to me and was delighted.
Decided to return with my wife to see if the White Swan was consistently good and it was - this place is a'find'. Only visit if you want good fresh food, well kept beer and a good welcome.
The friendliness and service were great, good knowledge of wines. Food was excellent, well presented and tasty.

Driving through looking for a pub lunch & found this place just off of main road. What a treat.
Beer was very good. With excellent choice.
Atmosphere warm an friendly.
Good service.
Pub was lovely and warm too on a chilly day.
Good choice of dishes. Some interesting specials.
We had pan fried sea bass( with black pudding, chorizo, potato wedges-this was delicious & cooked to perfection) & veggie dish (grilled aubergene,peppers, potato/leek rosti-superb).
Would definitely visit again.

Great food, with a lot of thought behind it, the deserts are massive and wonderful! I had a brilliant dining experience here and will be going back! The staff were attentive and friendly and the bar is well stocked with great variety!

Just like the other reviewer we found this unassuming place by accident. We were staying at a nearby hotel but didn't like the look of their very pricey menu, so ventured into the local village and found The White Swan. We had imaginative, restaurant-quality food in comfortable surroundings with friendly, efficient service. The wine list was also well put together and very reasonable. I would recommend The White Swan and will definitely go again if I am in the area.

We only found this family run pub by accident, in January, a couple of months after the present landlords took over. We'd turned off the A14 on our way home to go to another pub but it was closed and we had to go to Quy to turn round, stumbling on the White Swan in the process. Though it's nothing to look at from the outside, just another old fashioned local, we were hungry so gave it go. What a lucky break! It was so friendly, the menu so original and the food so good that we made a beeline when passing by again this month. The food was not simply as good - it was some of the finest we've had, certainly the best in any pub. We're both vegetarians. No problem. My Mille Feuille (a layered stack of peppers and aubergines with butternut squash puree, soft cheese, wilted spinach and roasted pine nuts, served on a vinegar, leek and potato rosti) was just sublime - one sensational wave of taste after another. And that was just a bar meal, priced at £7.85!!!! Julie had mushroom stuffed with Mozzarella, courgettes and cherry tomatoes with sweet potato croquettes on a watercress salad from the main menu at £9.50. Also fantastic. We met the chef on the way out and he spoke with such passion that you knew this was someone who loves his work. Again the service was very friendly. Though there were few people in the dining room the bar next door was packed and buzzing, the popularity of the Swan as a pub no doubt helped by the fact that it is independent from the major brewers so serves lot of guest beers - including some bottled beers from the landlady's brother, who has a brewery in Normandy. Apparently the Swan is packed for Sunday lunches when they do a nut roast they are particularly proud of (as well as the traditional roast,obviously).

Ate in the bar as opposed to the restaurant a couple of days ago. It was refreshing to see a veggie option that looked and tasted as though some thought had gone into it as opposed to the standard vegetable lasagne (reheated in a microwave) usually on offer. Thoroughly enjoyed every mouthful. The guys enjoyed the fact that the pub is a free house with a few different beers to choose from, they also enjoyed their steak pies. Prices very reasonable. If I didn't live so far away I would certainly be back.

전날 IL Piccolo mondo에서 조금은 실망스러운 식사를 하고 근방에 있는 펍에 가서 식사를 하기로 하고 리뷰를 검색하여 이 곳을 정했다.

들어가서는 원했던 분위기가 아니어서 조금 실망했지만 매우 저렴한 메뉴에 만족했고 음식의 질에 더욱 기분이 좋아졌다.

내 기억으로 캠브리지 주변에서 먹은 펍 음식중 가장 맛있는 곳. 강력 추천

Per chi visita San Gimignano ,e vuole provare una buona cucina locale (Toscana) questo ristorante e' il posto giusto.
Bruschette e primi piatti,favolosi,
Ottimo anche il vino (meno costoso).
Qualità' prezzo buono, realmente soddisfatto...
Da provare....ci rivedremo.
If you are into noodles this restaurant offers great food and does that at the right price. The services is also really nice!
Shrimp curry was the best with the right amount of spices and herbs. This restaurant constantly improves its dishes.
This was a very nice experience. The service was very friendly. The food was completely to my expectation and tasted home-cooked and made from fresh ingredients. I'll try the noodles next time
Food is great and taste like home cooked. Service is good too. Will try to order Vietnamese dishes next time.

Very delicious and rich, value-for-money, Vietnamese style of hot-pot. What you get is more than enough for dinner and above all, it's healthy food as well as food is prepared in boiled water. We also appreciated the friendly service,

First of all, I have only ordered take-away food at Kim Quy. Even though the restaurant looks nice, it does not invite me to stay in.

The food however is very good and you have more than enough. The friendly owner, with such a nice smile, is an excellent chef. I would definitely recommend Kim Quy for take-away.

PS: take nr A3! Yummie
when there for dinner, oh wow, the location is very nice, the restaurant decor is really romantic, the food was delicious, will come back soon
A bit slow (there _was_ a 16 person table next to us, so no real big deal) , but the food was delicious! Very friendly staff, nice atmosphere. True recommendation in Kortrijk!
This is a good restaurant run by a friendly woman. The food is excellent and not cheap at all, the service is outstanding. Been there several times.

Très bon repas, dans un cadre simple mais agréable. Dame très gentille, soucieuse de faire plaisir. Nous avons eu une remarque à faire, c'était tout de suite corrigé. Nous avons très bien mangé. Merci

Via Deliveroo bestelde ik hapjes, sushi, noodles met scampi en rijst met kip.
Alles was heel lekker maar vooral de sushi was TOP TOP TOP!

Heb hier zaterdag laatstleden voor het eerst take away besteld (coronatijd !).
Heel lekker !! Ook vriendelijke uitbaters. Zal niet bij één keer blijven. Echt een aanrader.

Gaan hier al jaren vaak een hapje eten en ook nu was het eten wederom zeer lekker.
Ook voor vegetariërs worden er lekkere schotels geserveerd.
Vriendelijke en sympathieke bediening met zéér lekkere authentieke Vietnamese keuken! Eten is prijs kwaliteit uitstekend. Eenvoudig maar zeer klassevolle inrichting.

We wouden het toch proberen na al de revieuws, het was een kalme avond.. maar de bediening? Lang wachten tegen we iets konden drinken, daarna een hapje het was nog niet op en het eten was er.. vriendelijk vonden we ze nu ook niet kijkt niet om naar de klanten.. bord was wel zeker mooi verzorgt maar helaas onze ding niet maar smaak verschilt natuurlijk , een beetje gemiste kans. Niet voor herhaalbaar vatbaar :)

Na reeds meerdere malen te hebben afgehaald, gisteren eens echt ter plekke gegeten, en eens wat genomen wat je niet in afhaal kan nemen: de Kim-qou fondue! Absolute aanrader, fondue in groentebouillon, met uitgebreid scala een kip, rund, vis, inktvis, krab, allerlei groenten die je naar believen in de bouillon laat garen. Volle smaken en absoluut vetarm!

Hele geslaagde avond!

Sobere inrichting van dit kleine restaurant maar heel vriendelijke bediening. Wij zijn onverwacht langsgegaan op zaterdagavond om 19u30 zonder reservatie en toch een plekje gekregen. Eerst aan de hoge tafeltjes achteraan maar konden dan verhuizen naar een aangenamer lager tafeltje.
Kaart is niet zo uitgebreid maar je kan kiezen tussen rijstgerechten, noedelgerechten, noedelsoepen en fondue (deze laatste was heel populair maar inderdaad een beetje onhandig als je met een grotere groep aan tafel zit). Lekkere voorgerechten met verschillende hapjes en lekkere noedelsoep met kip gegeten. Zeker een aanrader voor iemand die fan is van de oosterse keuken en eens nieuwe smaken wil proberen. Maar wel reserveren voor zaterdagavond !
Voor de eerste maal telefonisch besteld en onze maaltijd stond op tijd klaar om af te halen. Heerlijke smaken en vers bereid. Een echte aanrader...
Het is heerlijk om daar uit eten te gaan. Ik hou enorm van dit restaurant. Het is lekker en gezond. Mij zullen ze er nog vaak terugzien.

Het interieur werd onlangs vernieuwd, veel gezelliger nu. Altijd lekkere gerechten en grote hoeveelheden. Alles lijkt vers en is smaakvol. Vlotte bediening. Lekkere soep en hapjes. Elke bezoek was de moeite waard.
Heel lekker Vietnamees, hrel vriendelijke bediening en grote porties. Meestal krijgen we de pho bo niet op en nemen we de rest mee, dan kunnen we thuis nog eens van genieten...
Zeker een aanrader voor een snelle hap of een maaltijd in een leuke setting. Ontdek de magie van de Vietnamese keuken in dit gezellig plekje in het centrum van Kortrijk.

Hadden met 6 personen de fondue besteld.
Bij het voorgerecht kregen 2 van ons een bordje
waar de kipspiesjes ontbraken, terwijl de andere nog 10 min.
moesten wachten. De fondue zelf zag er allemaal vers uit, maar zeer
omslachtig om te eten daar het verwarmingstoestel en de fondueset
zeer hoog boven de tafel uitkwam. De bediening werd door een jong en
niet te ervaren persoon gedaan. Hadden de indruk dat er niet veel
moeite gedaan werd om het ons aangenaam te maken.
Door het vernieuwde interieur was het wel gezellig zitten, maar het toilet
zag er niet echt proper uit.
Voor een lunch mogelijks o.k. Maar om te gaan dineren met vrienden
geen echte aanrader.

eerste indruk: neutraal ingerichte maar nette zaak. Als je weinig tijd hebt, zijn er andere adressen. Zeer vriendelijk ontvangen, als je een avondje gezellig wil tafelen en je hebt wat tijd, dan kan je er hier van genieten: lekker gegeten voor een correcte prijs. Vietnamees maar zeer toegankelijke smaken.Voor de liefhebbers: eend (in verschillende variaties) is sterk aan te bevelen. Wens je een voorgerechtje te delen als aperitiefhapje dan kan dit perfect, of dessert delen, geen probleem. Omdat we mensen kennen met glutenallergie, even nagevraagd en zeer concrete antwoorden welke gerechten wel of niet, klonk echt betrouwbaar. Telefonisch reserveren is aan te bevelen (zaterdagavond om 20u werden geen extra klanten, die niet gereserveerd hadden, meer aangenomen).
Wij gingen op de middag gaan eten met enkele collega's. Voor de lunch betaal je slechts 12,50€ en heb je een voorgerechtje en een ruim-voldoende hoofdgerecht. Aanrader!

Op aanraden van Indonesische vriendin hierheen geweest met het gezin. Ligging is wat buiten centrum, vandaar door ons vroeger onbekend. Fris, goed geordend "westers"" interieur biedt plaats voor een max.30 personen. De bediening gebeurt iets traag afhankelijk van de bezetting in de keuken, maar uiterst vriendelijk en hulpvaardig. Soepen zijn geweldig en alles wordt bereid met verse groenten. De menukaarten zijn iets onhandig in gebruik. Ook de hoofdschotels zijn uiterst verzorgd en rijk van smaak. Keuze in dessert is wel langs de magere kant. Is ons echt heel goed meegevallen en we gaan zeker terug !
Sobere, smaakvolle inrichting, vriendelijke bediening en lekkere, eerlijke keuken. Aangename verrassing dus,we komen terug.
Lekkere Vietnamees, alles was vers en verzorgd. Voldoende gegeten en gedronken. Vriendelijke bediening en behulpzaam. Een aanrader.

Beetje uit het centrum, rechtover studentenhome van Vives. Kader is niet Oosters maar hedendaags, met vriendelijke gastvrouw. Wat op de tafel komt is echter des te Oosters. Knappe kaart met genoeg keuze, pikant is hier niet superpikant. Lekkere soepen, heerlijke keizerrollen en zalige nems.
Krokante eend is echt krokant.
Zijn hier al 20 jaar gevestigde waarde, maar we kenden het niet.
We komen zeker terug als we Kortrijk nog eens bezoeken.

heel lekkere keuken, allemaal verse bereidingen wij hadden als voorgerecht
carpacio en loempia's mooi geserveerd met garnituur.
als hoofdgerecht hadden wij gebakken eend met groenten en scampi in curry met groenten en rijst.
super vriendelijke bediening, overal heel proper en net, zelfs de keuken waar je kan binnen kijken.
en dit voor een schappelijke prijs, wij zijn favoriet en gaan zeker nog terug.
Authentieke Vietnamese keuken in een fris kader. De smaken zitten zeer goed en smaakt top! Uitstekende prijs/kwaliteit. Aanrader voor wie op het laatste moment nog een lekkere maaltijd zoekt!
Heerlijke maaltijd. Eenvoudige gerechten, maar super lekker klaar gemaakt. Perfecte prijs/kwaliteits verhouding.

vriendelijk, lekker, niet ver van huis... meer moet het niet zijn!

wij waren er al verschillende keren, dus klanten die terugkeren is de beste reclame.

meeneem is ook mogelijk.
Super lekker, oosters restaurantje, zowel de ontvangst als de gerechten zijn lekker en je hebt er meer dan genoeg. Prijs/kwaliteit een toppertje !
Heel lekker eten in een mooi interieur! Vriendelijk personeel!ik zou er zeker nog eens gaan eten. Ook mogelijk om af te halen, dus prima.

Zijn langs geweest voor de lunch. Een klein buffet. Word wel telkens terug aangevuld.
Het eten zelf vonden we niet speciaal. Hadden er meer van verwacht.
Fantastisch gegeten. We hebben de Vietnamese fondue genomen met twee. Meer dan voldoende e erg lekker.De witte huiswijn is ook uitstekend. Een aanrader.
Al 20-tal jaar klant hier en de kaart is al vaak veranderd waardoor dit de aanrader is voor deze keuken te Kortrijk, zeker als je er nog eens de supervriendelijke gastvrouw bijrekent

's Middags heerlijk gegeten in het prachtig vernieuwde restaurant.
De kaart heeft enkele nieuwe
nieuwe gerechten o.a. Pho.
Maaltijdsoep is heerlijk, dus kozen we met zijn allen voor Pho;
eentje met rund, eentje met krokante eend een eentje met zeevruchten. Mooie presentatie, en vooral fantastisch lekkere Pho( flinke portie!)! En met een vriendelijke en vlotte bediening.
Een echte aanrader voor wie houdt
van
de 'echte' Vietnamese keuken.

lekker eten, aangename gastvrouw. We kregen onze hoofdmaaltijd niet op en vroegen om het mee te krijgen en bestelden nog een paar soepen voor thuis, jammergenoeg is de rest van onze hoofdschotel met iemand anders meegegeven dus zonder naar huis met enkel een sorry! nu geniet anderen door ons betaald! geen herhaling meer!
Hier vind je de traditionele vietnamese keuken zoals de bazin ze van haar moeder geleerd heeft. Lekker eten met ruime porties, vriendelijke bediening.

Alhoewel het restaurant pas om 18u open gaat, was de gastvrouw zo vriendelijk ons een half uurtje vroeger te ontvangen. De gerechten waren bijzonder lekker en vers klaargemaakt. Een aanrader voor een redelijke prijs. Niet hip, maar wel lekker. Ongelofelijk dat blijkbaar nog maar weinig mensen de weg hiernaartoe gevonden hebben.

. . . . . .waren onze verwachtingen misschien te hoog !!! wij waren er met vrienden op een vrijdag voor de lunch , in buffetvorm - we waren aan de late kant (13u05) -er waren nog 3 gasten die reeds aan de koffie waren - - de vrouw was zeer vriendelijk bij het onthaal - we vroegen een fles wijn , die was nog maar ingeschonken en ze vroeg al direct om aan te schuiven voor het buffet !! we hadden zo het gevoel dat we rap moesten eten om daar zo rap mogelijk weg te zijn,het buffet was gepresenteerd in grootkeuken bakken ,de soep was lauw - het eten zal om 12u wel lekker geweest zijn maar had al te lang "verwarmd" geweest , bij de scampi's was het krokante korstje al zacht ,het vlees uitgedroogd en alles had warmer gekund - - we voelden ons geviseerd zo hebben we de koffie in het stad gaan drinken waar we meer op ons gemak zaten, neen . . .voor ons was het geen meerwaarde

typische keuken.fijn, vers en vriendelijke bediening. prachtig kader, lekkere fondu, prijs redelijk. wijn wel een beetje boven de normale prijs (weinig kennis van prijsklasse en dus zijn bepaalde wijnen hogere prijzen dan de arbeidsmarkt. Voor de rest een aanradder..

Lekker gegeten, we waren met z'n zessen op zondag na 6'en en het was lekker rustig. Het enige jammere was dat er niet meer was!

het restaurant zit naast een grote weg maar je hoort haast geen verkeer.

Altijd opnieuw een leuke ervaring. Zéér lekker eten , echte smaakbommen maar nooit overdreven. Loan runt haar zaak met passie, kennis en gedrevenheid .Het kader is gewoontjes en de prijzen aan de stevige kant. Spijtig dat er niet meer stoofpotjes op de kaart staan. Ik ga zeker terug bij een volgend bezoek aan Kortrijk.

De Fondue van het huis,
Is een schotel waar je nadien steeds aan terug denkt.
je praat er over met vrienden achteraf.
Leuk om aan vrienden of zakenpartners voor te stellen.
Gezonde en lekkere ingrediënten.
Kortom schitterend.

Bedankt voor de service

Eric Meersman

Gezellig kleinschalig vietnamees restaurant. De vrouw deze huizes staat in de keuken en in de zaal. Tijdnes de week over de middag is er een gevarieerd buffet. Voor die prijs moet he niet twijfelen...

Toen we er binnenkwamen, rook het niet al te fris... een probleempje met de verluchting, denk ik... Het rook zowat naar een vol appartement aan de zee dat de hele dag in de zon gelegen heeft... een geur die spontaan in me opkwam... De bediening (van de jongen) is ietwat aan de brute, ruwe kant... Er speelt loungemuziek en in een Vietnamees restaurant wil ik eigenlijk wel wat Oosters horen... Ik bestelde de Palm (33 cl stond er op de kaart en op de rekening) en het is dan ook heel onhandig om die in een glas van l'achouffe uit te schenken waar het streepje van de 25 cl net niet bereikt wordt... toch een beetje bedrog. Er was ook geen rundvlees meer aanwezig wat ons niet gezegd werd tot na we het besteld hadden... vreemd, want zo laat was het nog niet (20u30) en het restaurant zag er ook niet uit alsof het heel die dag heel druk was geweest...Het eten zelf was heel lekker en zeker niet te prijzig... Een goede keuze dus, maar een ietwat gemiste kans... 3,5/5

er zijn zo'n 35 plaatsen en het restaurant zat vol op zaterdagavond. De kokkin staat alleen in de keuken en haar dochter dient op. Goede en vriendelijke bediening. We hadden het menu genomen en hebben 1,5 uur moeten wachten op ons soep, na 2,5h hadden we ons voorgerecht. We zijn er om 19:00 aangekomen en waren pas om 23:00 buiten. Wel één van de beste Thai's die ik gegeten heb, jammer van de erg lange wachttijden.

Đi đến nhà hàng này với 8 người Việt Nam. Các món ăn là tốt và giá cả hợp lý. Nhìn chung, tôi muốn giới thiệu nơi này. Tôi nghĩ rằng tôi sẽ làm cho một nhận xét văn hóa mặc dù. Tôi đã đặt hàng một soda chanh mà tôi đã có trước đây và thích. Thật không may, tôi đã đọc sai thực đơn và dường như được bảo quản có nghĩa là thêm nhiều muối, điều mà tôi biết là tôi không thích. Khi đồ uống đến tôi nói tôi không thích món này và không gọi món đó. Người phục vụ đảm bảo với tôi đây là những gì tôi yêu cầu và đặt nó xuống và rời đi. Những người phục vụ hoặc người phục vụ ai đó một cái gì đó mà họ nói họ không muốn. Tôi muốn mạo hiểm nói rằng hầu hết các nhà hàng mà tôi đã đến sẽ ngay lập tức mang nó đi và hỏi tôi muốn gì. Mọi người trong nhà hàng có vẻ tốt và tất cả, nhưng tôi nghĩ họ cần một khóa bồi dưỡng về ý nghĩa của ngành dịch vụ.

Nằm ở phía tây của thành phố Đà Lạt, bạn sẽ rất ngạc nhiên vì không gian và đồng phục của nhân viên mang phong cách phương tây nhưng lại phục vụ các món ăn hương vị Việt. Như các món heo chua ngọt, tôm sốt me....

Địa điểm đẹp, cung cấp một cái gì đó khác biệt với nhiều nhà hàng địa phương khác. Chủ quán rất chu đáo và giới thiệu cho chúng tôi rượu vang Việt Nam thực sự ổn.
Thực phẩm có chất lượng cao và tất cả đều rất sạch sẽ.

Dựa trên những đánh giá tích cực trên Tripadvisor, chúng tôi đã biến nhà hàng này thành điểm dừng chân ăn tối đầu tiên ở Lat. . . ấn tượng đầu tiên là nghiệt ngã. Cánh cửa mở ra chỉ để lộ bốn thực khách khác, những người đeo ba lô trông không vui nhìn chằm chằm vào nồi lẩu các loại của họ trong khi người phục vụ đưa cho họ một cuộc biểu tình về cách ăn. Chúng tôi được dẫn đến một cái bàn cạnh cửa hoàn chỉnh với khăn trải bàn bẩn từ một bữa ăn trước đó và những bức vẽ graffiti vô duyên trên tường. Vẫn hy vọng thức ăn sẽ bù đắp cho sự thiếu thốn của môi trường xung quanh, chúng tôi đã chuyển đơn đặt hàng của mình cho người phục vụ chắc chắn để được thông báo rằng một số món ăn không có sẵn vì nhà hàng đã đóng cửa trong năm ngày qua và không ai bận tâm đến việc đặt lại bếp. Cũng bỏ qua thực tế không có loại rượu nào khác ngoài địa phương giống Lat có sẵn, mặc dù có một danh sách rượu vang phong nha, và ổn định để chờ đợi bữa ăn của chúng tôi.

Món salad thân cây sen đáng được nhắc đến nhưng món cá caramen trong nồi đất sét, một loại lương thực Việt Nam thậm chí một đứa trẻ có thể làm, đã đến bàn sủi bọt, che giấu một sự thật khủng khiếp. Những miếng cá, được ngụy trang dưới dạng mỡ lợn, được tăng cường hóa học hoàn toàn không có hương vị trong khi nước sốt đã tách thành các lớp đường và chất béo. Chúng tôi cũng đã thử món Chua Chua (súp cá chua) có vẻ ngoài và tính nhất quán của nước rửa chén bẩn và rõ ràng đã sử dụng loại cá bí ẩn tương tự như Lẩu, được làm sáng lên một chút bởi những miếng dứa tươi và nêm cà chua. Một vài nấm Shiitake được bù nước làm tròn bữa tối kỳ dị này.

Khi chúng tôi rời đi, chủ quán và gia đình anh ta đang ngồi ở cuối nhà hàng thưởng thức bữa tối của họ và chỉ lờ chúng tôi cho đến khi chúng tôi yêu cầu hóa đơn. Chúng tôi thất vọng và đói.

Rõ ràng nhắm vào khách du lịch phương Tây, Quý hoàn toàn được đánh giá cao và có rất nhiều nhà hàng khác ở Lat phục vụ thức ăn ngon hơn, với không gian đẹp hơn và dịch vụ tốt. Quả thực bữa ăn rất tệ, nó đã truyền cảm hứng cho bài đánh giá Tripadvisor đầu tiên của chúng tôi! ! Chúng tôi đã ăn với những người bạn đồng hành từ Sài Gòn, những người thường xuyên ghé thăm Lat, hai lần và có những món ăn địa phương giật gân trong cả hai dịp nên thành phố có rất nhiều nhà hàng ngon. . . chỉ không phải cái này

Chúng tôi đến đây vào lúc đêm khuya khi nó trống rỗng và tôi rất vui vì chúng tôi đã làm vậy! Loc (chủ sở hữu) rất ngọt ngào và chào đón chúng tôi mặc dù đã 9 giờ tối, khi hầu hết các nhà hàng khác trong khu vực này đều đóng cửa. Chúng tôi đã có cơm chiên hải sản, lẩu rau, rau muống và mực chua ngọt. Thức ăn rất ngon - bạn có thể nói nó được làm cẩn thận. Có rất nhiều trong thực đơn cho người ăn chay và ăn thịt có thể khó tìm thấy ở Việt Nam. Hoàn toàn muốn giới thiệu nơi này!

Thức ăn tuyệt vời cộng với lòng hiếu khách tuyệt vời đã khiến quãng đường dài từ khách sạn của tôi trở nên đáng giá. Các món ăn là một niềm vui cho pallet và mang lại một hương vị đích thực của Việt Nam. Dịch vụ này rất tuyệt, chủ sở hữu tốt bụng và nói tiếng Anh tốt.

Chúng tôi đã đến Quy đầu tiên trong Lay dựa trên những đánh giá tích cực và chúng tôi đã có khoảng thời gian tuyệt vời. Các nhân viên rất đáng yêu, rất chu đáo và tốt bụng. Chúng tôi đã có một loạt các menu và yêu thích tất cả. Món tráng miệng có thể bị bỏ lỡ nhưng vẫn đáng đồng tiền bát gạo. Rất khuyến khích và mặc dù nó không bận rộn, đó là mất mát của người khác!

Nhà hàng này là LOVELY! ! Chúng tôi đã xảy ra để có được trong một trong một thời gian yên tĩnh - chúng tôi nghĩ rằng họ đã đóng cửa và có nhà hàng cho chính mình. Họ chủ sở hữu là sooo tốt đẹp! Ông đã đưa ra những khuyến nghị tuyệt vời - đây là trải nghiệm ăn uống tốt nhất cho chúng tôi ở Đà Lạt! Thực phẩm tuyệt vời như vậy và các lựa chọn ăn chay tuyệt vời! ! Chúng tôi sẽ trở lại!
Brilliant thực phẩm và dịch vụ. Chủ sở hữu là G tuyệt đối, tiếng Anh tốt và rất đáng yêu. Đề xuất địa điểm này nếu bạn đến thăm Đà Lạt.

Nơi này thật tuyệt. Có chả giò trên nhà, thức ăn ngon (chắc chắn sẽ giới thiệu nồi đất sét thịt heo!) Người chủ nói tiếng Anh hoàn hảo và là một người rất thân thiện! Chắc chắn chắc chắn sẽ đến đây, không thể đề nghị nơi này đủ!

Chúng tôi đã ăn ở đây vào 2 trong 3 đêm ở Đà Lạt sau khi đọc những bài đánh giá tích cực về cố vấn chuyến đi. Có một lựa chọn tuyệt vời của thực phẩm, tất cả thực sự ngon và giá cả hợp lý. Chúng tôi luôn cảm thấy được chào đón và chủ sở hữu là tuyệt vời về việc phân loại các món ăn đậu phộng miễn phí cho bản thân mình. Chắc chắn đáng để ghé thăm!

Nằm ở phía tây của thành phố Đà Lạt, bạn sẽ rất ngạc nhiên vì không gian và đồng phục của nhân viên mang phong cách phương tây nhưng lại phục vụ các món ăn hương vị Việt. Như các món heo chua ngọt, tôm sốt me....

Địa điểm đẹp, cung cấp một cái gì đó khác biệt với nhiều nhà hàng địa phương khác. Chủ quán rất chu đáo và giới thiệu cho chúng tôi rượu vang Việt Nam thực sự ổn.
Thực phẩm có chất lượng cao và tất cả đều rất sạch sẽ.

Dựa trên những đánh giá tích cực trên Tripadvisor, chúng tôi đã biến nhà hàng này thành điểm dừng chân ăn tối đầu tiên ở Lat. . . ấn tượng đầu tiên là nghiệt ngã. Cánh cửa mở ra chỉ để lộ bốn thực khách khác, những người đeo ba lô trông không vui nhìn chằm chằm vào nồi lẩu các loại của họ trong khi người phục vụ đưa cho họ một cuộc biểu tình về cách ăn. Chúng tôi được dẫn đến một cái bàn cạnh cửa hoàn chỉnh với khăn trải bàn bẩn từ một bữa ăn trước đó và những bức vẽ graffiti vô duyên trên tường. Vẫn hy vọng thức ăn sẽ bù đắp cho sự thiếu thốn của môi trường xung quanh, chúng tôi đã chuyển đơn đặt hàng của mình cho người phục vụ chắc chắn để được thông báo rằng một số món ăn không có sẵn vì nhà hàng đã đóng cửa trong năm ngày qua và không ai bận tâm đến việc đặt lại bếp. Cũng bỏ qua thực tế không có loại rượu nào khác ngoài địa phương giống Lat có sẵn, mặc dù có một danh sách rượu vang phong nha, và ổn định để chờ đợi bữa ăn của chúng tôi.

Món salad thân cây sen đáng được nhắc đến nhưng món cá caramen trong nồi đất sét, một loại lương thực Việt Nam thậm chí một đứa trẻ có thể làm, đã đến bàn sủi bọt, che giấu một sự thật khủng khiếp. Những miếng cá, được ngụy trang dưới dạng mỡ lợn, được tăng cường hóa học hoàn toàn không có hương vị trong khi nước sốt đã tách thành các lớp đường và chất béo. Chúng tôi cũng đã thử món Chua Chua (súp cá chua) có vẻ ngoài và tính nhất quán của nước rửa chén bẩn và rõ ràng đã sử dụng loại cá bí ẩn tương tự như Lẩu, được làm sáng lên một chút bởi những miếng dứa tươi và nêm cà chua. Một vài nấm Shiitake được bù nước làm tròn bữa tối kỳ dị này.

Khi chúng tôi rời đi, chủ quán và gia đình anh ta đang ngồi ở cuối nhà hàng thưởng thức bữa tối của họ và chỉ lờ chúng tôi cho đến khi chúng tôi yêu cầu hóa đơn. Chúng tôi thất vọng và đói.

Rõ ràng nhắm vào khách du lịch phương Tây, Quý hoàn toàn được đánh giá cao và có rất nhiều nhà hàng khác ở Lat phục vụ thức ăn ngon hơn, với không gian đẹp hơn và dịch vụ tốt. Quả thực bữa ăn rất tệ, nó đã truyền cảm hứng cho bài đánh giá Tripadvisor đầu tiên của chúng tôi! ! Chúng tôi đã ăn với những người bạn đồng hành từ Sài Gòn, những người thường xuyên ghé thăm Lat, hai lần và có những món ăn địa phương giật gân trong cả hai dịp nên thành phố có rất nhiều nhà hàng ngon. . . chỉ không phải cái này

Chúng tôi đến đây vào lúc đêm khuya khi nó trống rỗng và tôi rất vui vì chúng tôi đã làm vậy! Loc (chủ sở hữu) rất ngọt ngào và chào đón chúng tôi mặc dù đã 9 giờ tối, khi hầu hết các nhà hàng khác trong khu vực này đều đóng cửa. Chúng tôi đã có cơm chiên hải sản, lẩu rau, rau muống và mực chua ngọt. Thức ăn rất ngon - bạn có thể nói nó được làm cẩn thận. Có rất nhiều trong thực đơn cho người ăn chay và ăn thịt có thể khó tìm thấy ở Việt Nam. Hoàn toàn muốn giới thiệu nơi này!

Thức ăn tuyệt vời cộng với lòng hiếu khách tuyệt vời đã khiến quãng đường dài từ khách sạn của tôi trở nên đáng giá. Các món ăn là một niềm vui cho pallet và mang lại một hương vị đích thực của Việt Nam. Dịch vụ này rất tuyệt, chủ sở hữu tốt bụng và nói tiếng Anh tốt.

Món ngon Việt Nam! Bánh mì tươi tự làm nhồi với các loại thịt và rau thơm ngon trong phạm vi $ 5 làm cho thỏa thuận tốt nhất trong thị trấn. Dịch vụ là tuyệt vời và nhanh chóng. Có một vài bàn nếu bạn muốn ăn ở và tận hưởng bầu không khí. Nếu bạn chưa thử một phụ tiếng Việt thì đây là nơi để bạn có trải nghiệm đầu tiên. Đồ uống trà bong bóng được làm với các thành phần tươi.

Bạn đồng hành của tôi và tôi đang ở trên một quán ăn ẩm thực để tìm những chiếc bánh sandwich Việt Nam ngon nhất trong thị trấn. Tìm kiếm của chúng tôi đã dẫn chúng ta đến tận trung tâm của thị trấn Trung Quốc (một góc phần tư của thành phố có ấn tượng hơi sặc sỡ) đến nhà hàng cất cánh "lỗ hổng trong bức tường" khiêm tốn này. Tôi phải thú nhận sự lo lắng của tôi lúc đầu, tôi chưa bao giờ thử một người Việt Nam và nội thất làm ít để thuyết phục tôi - một không gian nhỏ, lờ mờ với rèm tắm ngăn cách khu nhà bếp, các bức tường đủ trần để làm cho trang trí Spartan có vẻ xa hoa, ngoại trừ một tờ giấy viết tay nhỏ nhắn, nhiều lớp, viết lời khuyên về "Tiền mặt") - nhưng nếu tôi lo lắng về việc tôi ăn ở đâu hơn là những gì tôi ăn thì tôi sẽ không bao giờ phát hiện ra mỏ vàng này.

* nhà hàng có một máy ATM với lệ phí dịch vụ rút tiền $ 2 khiêm tốn trong trường hợp bạn không mang theo tiền mặt.

 [Sự ra đời của những người Việt Nam đến từ một hỗn hợp của chủ nghĩa thực dân Pháp và nấu ăn truyền thống Việt Nam, sau đó phát triển phổ biến như một món ăn đường phố ở Sài Gòn trước khi mang đến Bắc Mỹ trong những năm 1970].

Trong khi thực đơn bao gồm một loạt các món khác nhau, từ bánh sandwich đến súp, tôi đã chọn "Satay Beef Sub" $ 6 trong khi bạn đồng hành của tôi, sau một lúc do dự chọn "Satay Chicken Sub" cho những người thích cay, hãy cân nhắc thêm Jalapeno . Nữ tiếp viên rất kiên nhẫn trong khi chúng tôi tranh luận. Tôi đã rất ngạc nhiên khi thấy nó đơn giản như thế nào, không giống như các nhà hàng dân tộc khác với thực đơn phức tạp hơn, với vô số các món ăn thường kém dịch sang người không được sáng tạo.

Bản thân họ là bản giao hưởng ngọt ngào và chua. Nếu bạn đang mong đợi bất cứ điều gì tương tự như tàu điện ngầm, chuẩn bị để được ngạc nhiên thú vị. Điểm mấu chốt của "B nh m sandwiches" là phần bằng nhau của thịt bò ướp cùng với rau ngâm
 (cilantro, dưa chuột, cà rốt) Được bao bọc trong một chiếc bánh mì giòn, có độ dày 6 inch, mỗi miếng đều mang một hình thức hài lòng cụ thể cho bảng màu, không có chút mayonnaise nào mọc ra từ bánh mì. hương vị trong nhà của những gì tôi phỏng đoán có chứa đậu nành, mè và giấm gạo. Toàn bộ việc ăn nó khá văn minh, hầu như không đòi hỏi cả hai tay, một lần nữa trái ngược với những người phương Tây, nơi người ta phải, trong một tuyệt vọng cố gắng, trục vớt của một con tàu chìm liên tục.

Quán bánh sandwich Nhơn Hòa tiếp tục là một món ăn được yêu thích của Edmonton trong suốt 20 năm qua và hiện đang đứng đầu danh sách các món ăn châu Á, thoải mái của tôi.

Tôi biết điều này thông qua bạn gái Việt Nam của tôi. Quả thực là một trong những nơi tốt nhất để có được một phụ Việt đích thực!
Tôi thường đặt hàng trực tuyến và luôn hài lòng với người đăng ký của họ. Họ đã luôn luôn cẩn thận bọc các tàu con của họ và dán nhãn từng cái.

Tôi thấy tàu ngầm Việt nhẹ hơn và tốt hơn tàu điện ngầm, nhưng đó là ý kiến của tôi. Oh và họ có cơm + mì cay ngon quá! Tất cả các thực phẩm đều có giá cả rất hợp lý và chất lượng tốt, đích thực.

Nhưng đối với bất kỳ ai bị dị ứng, bạn nên gọi điện thoại hoặc hỏi hoặc có một thứ tự đặc biệt.
O melhor sorvete de Floriano. Qualidade de produtos e diversidade de sabores. Indico os milk shakes e a banana split. Boa localização.
